She continued the business when she was married and now she supports herself and her children with a little help from her oldest son who works as a construction helper.  Her other children help her in her business.  Only her youngest child is still in school.

Her monthly income is 2000 Quetzales (US $256) with a profit of Q1200 (US $153).  With her loan she plans to travel to Guatemala City to buy solutions, bottles and wire in bulk.  Her projected profit with her new business plan and buying in bulk is Q1876 (US $240) which is an increase of 56% and will allow her to better feed her family and perhaps allow one or two of the boys to return to school.

loans.use: to buy in bulk the supplies she needs for her business selling bubbles at fairs and fiestas.

loans.name: Elwin Alexander

texts.es:
Elwin, está casado vive con su esposa y su hija. El, se dedica  a la venta de verduras y frutas, asimismo  a la agricultura, lo realiza junto con su esposa en horarios de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de frutas y verduras, tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, peras y también tomates, chiles, cebollas, entre otras. Esta inversión le ayudara a tener más productos  de inversión y para ofrecerle a la clientela.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio  de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Elwin is married and lives with his wife and daughter.  He makes his living selling vegetables and fruits.  Additionally, he earns a living in agriculture.  He works together with his wife from 6:00am to 2:00pm.
The loan that Elwin is requesting will allow him to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as: apples, grapes, oranges, pears and also tomatoes, chiles, onions and other items.  This investment will help him to have more investment products to offer to his clientele. 
Elwin's dream is to expand his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, oranges, pears and also tomatoes, chiles, onions and other items.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Armandine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Armandine est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Armandine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de dix ans que Armandine mène comme activité la vente de bols, plastiques et de bassines en aluminium dans sa région. Armandine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Armandine désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO.
texts.en: The group JESUKPEGO has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Armandine, has her hand raised in the photo. Armandine is 27 years old and married to a man named Benoit. The couple has two school aged children for whom they are responsible. Armandine never completed much schooling. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. For about the past 10 years, Armadine has sold bowl sets, plastic containers and aluminum bowls in her area. She purchases her inventory in a city in Bénin. In order to strengthen sales and respond better to her client's demands, Armandine is requested this loan along with the other members of JESUKPEGO.

loans.use: to purchase bowl sets, plastic containers and aluminum bowls.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier.  La représentante du  groupe, Juridithe (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Abel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Juridithe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Juridithe vend des tissus et des bijoux dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Juridithe vend des produits cosmétiques. Juridithe s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Juridithe et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: FIFONSI has three members who all live in the same neighborhood.  The group representative, Juridithe (hand raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a man named Abel. The couple has three children who attend school, with two who are still their financial responsibility. Juridithe lives together her children and husband and together they are responsible for the household expenses. For about the past 15 years, Juridithe sells fabric and jewelry in her area. As a side business, she also sells cosmetics. Juridithe buys her inventory in a city in Benin. This is the third time Juridithe and the other members of FIFONSI have requested a loan with ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to client demand. The first two loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and jewelry.

loans.name: Las Chijinis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CHIJINIS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de tejidos, tienda de pintura, tienda de barrio, venta de detergentes, taller de metalmecánica.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que anteriormente ella vendía jugos, posteriormente decide realizar almuerzos a solicitud de su clientela.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, papas y pollos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la orientación de las asesoras de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Chijinis” will start its third lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Collpani.  It is made up of eight members and run by a board of directors, of which Señora Rosmery is the President.  The communal bank members' businesses are varied and include: making fabric, a paint store, a neighborhood store, selling detergents and a metallurgical workshop. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small business owners, of which Señora Rosmery is one.  She says that this is her third cycle with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to join by an outreach worker from the institution who visited her in her home.  Señora Rosmery currently has a business selling food.  Previously she sold juices, and later decided to make lunches, at the request of her clientele. 
 
The loan that she is taking out will increase her capital (to purchase rice, potatoes and chicken) that she acquires in the markets in El Alto and later to make and sell the food from her sales stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income for her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Rosmery says that she likes the orientations from the loan counselors.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Perla has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Reina De Jesus

texts.es:
Reina, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la venta de mariscos; este le servirá para comprar pescado rojo y blanco, curbina, macarela, camarón, lonja de tiburón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que le permitió adquirir variedad de mariscos. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina is in need of a new loan so that she can continue to invest in seafood for resale.  She will use the proceeds to purchase white as well as red varieties of fish, curbina, mackerel, shrimp, shark steaks and other items.

Her previous loan was very helpful, since it enabled her to acquire a variety of seafood.  Her financial situation and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy white as well as red varieties of fish, curbina, mackerel, shrimp, shark steaks and other items.

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
Alina, de 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos queridos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad respectivamente quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los verdes campos de su localidad, Alina tiene sus cultivos de papa y alverja, todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima sale a trabajar sus tierras, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Alina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alina, 33, is a very modest and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her two beloved children, ages 6 and 2, who are the motivation for all her efforts.

Alina has her potato and pea crops in the green fields of her town.   Every morning, regardless of the weather, she goes to her fields to work with great care.  She has 15 years of experience and considers the hardest part to be fumigating her crops.  In time she wants to buy more land to increase her production.

This is her fifth Kiva loan.  She feels it'll be very beneficial to her economic growth, so she promises to make her payments punctually.

Alina will invest the 3000 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Milagro Gregoria

texts.es:
Milagro, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: leña, maíz y gas.
Cuenta la Sra. Milagro que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones  económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Milagro needs to get a new loan to continue investing in her business selling tortillas.  This will help her buy the ingredients, such as firewood, corn, and gas.

Milagro says the previous loan helped her increase her sales and earn more income.  Her economic situation has improved and her family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and gas

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
Maria Eugenia, 29, is a young mother of three that lives with her family in Totolapan, Morelos. Maria walks almost 10km (6 miles) every morning to sell the vegetables and beans that her family plants. She is determined to make the trip and other sacrifices to give her children a better life. Maria´s house only has one bedroom where she sleeps with her husband Franco, a construction worker, and their three children Brenda, Emily and Franco junior. 

Maria and Franco together make around USD400 a month, so the house that they have today is the result of years of work and savings. Since Maria and Franco do not have formal jobs and their income is low and variable, neither of them have access to credit from banks or other organizations.

Maria has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for her kids and a bathroom for the family.  She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. Franco has the skills needed to complete the home. 

Maria and Franco will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new room will give the kids their own space to play, sleep and study and more privacy to Maria and Franco. Maria is a hard working mother that wants to give a better and more comfortable life to her kids.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a bedroom and bathroom for her three children

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives with her husband, Mario, and two children, Valeria and Alvaro, in Totolapan Morelos. Maria has been working in the market buying and selling vegetables since she was 12 years old, almost 11 years. Maria is known for being a hard working, loving mother and for selling the most flavorful vegetables. Maria and Mario work hard to give their children the opportunity they didn't have to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life.

Valeria and Alvaro are now two fast growing teenagers and sharing the room with their parents has become a challenge. They both need their own space to study, sleep and live. Maria is always looking out for her children and understands the importance of giving each of them their space at this critical age. Maria and Mario make no more than $450 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible to them.

For the last three months Maria and Mario have been saving to build two new rooms and one bathroom to their house. Maria needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. This addition will give everyone the space they need and a space to fully develop. 

Maria and Mario will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new construction will give her children more time to study and do the homework since they will have their own space. Maria is aware that  dedication and hard work is what and will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room for her two children

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a vegetable farmer in Totolapan, Morelos. He cares and loves his vegetables only second after his wife Jenny and his two daughters Lissete and Barbara. Omar has been planting vegetables since he was a little boy and spends almost all his time in the field because he knows it is the only way to make sure his products will have the best quality.

Omar and his family live in a small house for four people with a tin roof. This house is the result of years of work of Omar and sacrifices the family had to make. The tin roof makes the house really humid in spring and summer and very cold in winter. These harsh conditions  have cause the family, especially the youngest daughter, to develop respiratory problems. 

Omar hopes to build a new room so the girls can stop sleeping in the living room and the parents can recover the family space. The girls are excited about having their own room and a place where they can sit with their family in the afternoons. 

Omar and Jenny have been saving for the last three months to replace the roof with a proper cement roof and to build a nice room for the kids. Omar spends the whole day at his work but unfortunately only makes around $350 USD a month and that only if he manages to sell everything. Because he has low income informal job, he does not have access to credit from other organizations. 

Omar is requesting this loan to finish paying for the materials he needs to build a proper roof and room for his girls. Omar will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This home improvement is just another way for Omar to continue fighting to give a better life to his family and a better chance to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper roof for his house and a bedroom for his daughters

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.en:
Luis Ernesto is a farmer and the father of a son who suffers from a chronic illness and has breathing difficulties especially in his current home since it lacks proper insulation. 

Every morning Luis gets up at 3:00 am to work in the field. He plants tomatoes, cactus and cucumber in Totolapan, Morelos. Luis and Beatriz, his wife, are always trying to find new products to plant and sell to give their family a better life. Their hard work earns them roughly $350 USD a month.

Luis has worked hard to buy a piece of land and start building his house. He wishes to build a house that he can leave to his son and future members of his family. Right now his house only has a room and an open porch. Luis has been saving for the last three months to build two additional rooms and a bathroom. This loan will help him make the payment for the materials needed for construction. Luis has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and has irregular cash flows.
 
Luis and Beatriz will work together to build this addition to their home. They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, the new closed bedroom for their son will help him overcome his constant sickness. In less than 3 months, Luis and Beatriz will be able to live in a better house giving Giovanni and their future children a better life.

loans.use: to buy material to build bedrooms for his family

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mao, 22, has one child. Mao and her husband are farmers who plant corn on one hectare of farmland and also work as paid workers to earn additional income. Mao can earn about 13,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Mao is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan 500,000 KHR each. Mao will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her corn healthily and also hopes to grow more corn to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely, 37 years old, is married and they are blessed with three children. She's been in the direct selling business for almost one year; with this business, she's earning a net income of Php 2,000 a month. 

Due to lack of capital in her business, she would like a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, and beauty soap. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will improve and expand.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, toothpaste, and beauty soap

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en:
Sreynak, 38, lives with her husband and four children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava and rubber for 12 years, and supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 41,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Sreynak has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy more rubber seeds for planting. 

She hopes to grow her agribusiness to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more rubber seeds for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from dressmaking.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carlota Eneyda

texts.es:
Carlota,  es una persona trabajadora y madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años y no recibe ayuda del extranjero. Ella, posee una tienda de productos básicos del hogar, inicia dicho oficio como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, lo cual lo realiza de 7:00am – 4:00pm.
El crédito que solicita le permitirá comprar golosinas, pan, jugos, sodas, huevos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, verduras, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, aumentar el inventario y por ende incrementar sus ganancias.
El sueño de Carlota es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlota's a hardworking person and a single mother.  She has a son, 10, and receives no help from abroad.  She has a store where she sells basic household products that she started as a source of income for her family.  She works from 7 a.m. until 4 p.m.

The loan she's requesting will allow her to buy candy, bread, juice, soda, eggs, beans, rice, sugar, vegetables, and other products.  This investment will help her improve her business, increase her inventory, and consequently increase her profits.

Carlota's dream is to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, a 35-year-old married mother of one, lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has owned and operated a pedicab transportation and rental business in the local community for four years to earn a living. Her husband drives her tricycle in his free time, but it is mostly rented out to their neighbors.

Jennifer, who joined GDMPC in 2011, has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP for the repair and maintenance of her pedicab. In the future, she wants to improve her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her pedicab.

loans.name: Edda

texts.en: Edda is 48 years old, married and the mother of nine children, five of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 29,500 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as sugar, soap, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries. Edda has taken out and repaid 22 previous loans from NWTF, and has been running her general store for 11 years. She earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal, vegetables and nipa, a type of construction material. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en: Lam, 43, is married and lives with her husband and four children in a village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rubber for eight years, and earn about 27,000 KHR per day, which they used largely to feed their family. Lam leads a two-person loan group and is applying for her first loan while her partner is applying for her second. She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her goal is to increase her farm's output and thereby improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, soap and juice. She has been in her current line of work for 10 years, and supplements income by selling food that she cooks. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with ten children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 4 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and farming rice.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lay down a concrete slab.

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is a 54-year-old married mother of six children living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To support her family, Seak has been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland. To increase their income, her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 19,000KHR per day.
Seak’s group consists of two members and she is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 42-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest is 24, while the youngest is 9.

She engages in making crab nets. She makes and sells crab nets made of bamboo. Aside from making crab nets, in order to receive more income, she fishes. She then sells the fish. Due to a lack of capital to support her fishing activity, Nancy requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more materials for fishing, to increase her daily catch. In the future, Nancy hopes to expand her fishing business to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. Virginia has been engaged in a farming business, together with her husband, for more than 33 years now. This is the source of their income.

Virginia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Virginia believes and is optimistic that they will be able to improve the productivity of their farm. Virginia wants to expand their farming venture so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 50, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Delfin and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her product is beef meat. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. She also sells charcoal and pineapple for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of beef to sell.

Delia dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beef to sell.

loans.name: Marlen Yamileth

texts.es:
Marlen, es una persona casada y no tiene hijos por el momento, asimismo no recibe ayuda del extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural para obtener ingresos y así cambiar su situación económica, el oficio lo realiza de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería, tales como: vitaminas para nervios, capsulas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas, brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes por el medicamente que ofrece y mejorar su negocio.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlen is married and has no children at the moment. She does not receive assistance from anyone living abroad. Marlen sells natural medicines in order to generate income, which has changed her financial situation. She works from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy a variety of merchandise such as vitamins for nerves, capsules, and other products. This investment will help to increase her sales and provide better service to her customers with the medicines that she offers. As a result, her business will improve. Her dream is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for nerves, capsules, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and to pay for labor and soil preparation.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Chea is a 47-year-old mother of five children. She is a rice farmer who farms rice on three hectare of farmland. Together, they can earn about 27,300 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 11,000 KHR each day.

Chea is a first-cycle client with VisonFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 185,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 52 años es un hombre responsable y vive en compañía de su esposa Doris en su casa propia ya que sus hijos son independientes y viven fuera de su ciudad. El trabajo al que dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo es la agricultura, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas cultiva no solo hortalizas de toda variedad sino también tubérculos, pues las tierras que posee tienen agua y son muy fértiles por lo que no tiene inconvenientes y en cada cosecha comercializa sus sembríos a buen precio en el mercado da su ciudad. Comenta que gracias a sus ganancias, hoy en día posee 8 vacas de buena calidad a las que muy pronto podrá extraerles leche fresca para tener un ingreso extra. Ahora se encuentra preparándose para la temporada de siembra pues el tiempo es propicio. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.. Juan, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juan, who is 52-years old, is a responsible man who lives with his wife, Doris, in his own home.  His children live independently from him outside of his city.  The work that Juan dedicates his time and effort to is agriculture.  On his own agricultural land he grows not only all types of vegetables but also tubers.  His lands have plenty of water and are very fertile, so he never has any problems.   Juan sells the products of each harvest at a good price in his city's market.  Thanks to his earnings, he now has eight good quality cows that will produce milk very soon.  That will give him an extra income.  Juan is now preparing for the planting season; it is a favorable time for it.  This is Juan's first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial help he is receiving to keep moving forward.  In addition, he promises to repay his loan punctually.   Juan will invest the S/.1000 soles ($375 USD) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish his sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeanilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling rice and farming vegetables. Jeanilyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Jeanilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Annalisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming vegetables. Annalisa is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle, used in her transport business.

Annalisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle, used in a transport business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising chickens. Vilma is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, soap, rice, and other groceries for her general store business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, soap, rice, and other groceries

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 47 years old and is widowed with eight children.

Mila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, noodles, etc.

Mila has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and vegetable-selling businesses.

Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de zapatillas, venta de cosméticos, venta de CD’s, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, producción de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de producción de leche; este negocio lo emprendió ya que anteriormente trabajaba de esta forma con sus padres, posteriormente decide tener su independencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ternero) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente realizará la crianza para posteriormente lo comercializar la leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE PAPA” communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Virginia is the treasurer. The association members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling cleaning products, selling slippers, selling cosmetics, selling CD's, a neighborhood store, selling clothes and milk production. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, among whom is Virginia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her house. Now she has a business selling milk. She started this business because previously she did this work with her parents. Later she decided to go off on her own.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital  by buying a calf that she will acquire from the fairs nearby the city of El Alto. Later she will raise it to sell the milk. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a father of one from Thika, has a business as a grocer. He also runs a motorcycle transport business as his secondary business. He is married to Romanah who helps him in selling the groceries. He earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his third loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase kale, cabbages, oranges, tomatoes and potatoes. Additional income will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Ayub would like to build a permanent residential house and also buy spare parts for his motorcycle. 

He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase kale, cabbages, oranges, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta is a 45-year-old woman, married to Nitanel, 47. She has seven children: Iwan, 21, college student; Djindro, 19, senior high student; Michael, 17, Ojek driver; Yandri, 15, elementary student; Alfred, 12, elementary student; Juan, 7, elementary student; and Yunita, 3, pre-school student. 

Antoneta runs a kiosk, which sells daily basic need items such as rice, cooking oil, coffee, salt, sugar, vegetables, etc. At the same time, she also makes and sells woven fabric to the local shops downtown, to support her family needs. She initiated both the kiosk and weaving businesses in 2006 with her own capital. 

She has asked TLM for an additional 10,000,000 IDR loan in order to add more stock to her kiosk, to purchase more basic materials for her weaving business, and also to fulfill her children's tuition. She hopes that with this loan, both her businesses and her children's education will be more successful.

loans.use: to add more stock to her kiosk, to purchase more basic materials for her weaving business, and also to pay for her children's tuition

loans.name: Darwin Aladino

texts.es:
Darwin  25  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene  dos  hijos,  convive con su esposa e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías. Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Darwin se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz  y cría de pollos y chanchos. Solicita el crédito para Comprar semilla de calidad, fertilizantes. 
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio.  Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas  cada semana. 
Su sueño es aumentar la productividad. Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old and lives with his common law wife and two children in Ventanas Canton of Los Rios Province.

Most of the members of the "VRC Avanza" communal bank are farmers or raise livestock, They were raised and reside in the Aquas Frias area. 

Darwin is a farmer. He plants corn and raises chickens and pigs. He is requesting this loan to buy quality seed and fertilizer. With the help of this loan he can buy the fertilizer at a low price. He buys his supplies in Ventanas on a weekly basis. His goal is to increase his productivity. He enjoys spending his free time at home with his family.

loans.use: to buy quality seed like corn and beans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jubentino

texts.es:
Jubentino, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir, ya que iniciara la siembra de granos básicos, es por ello que solicita un nuevo préstamo, el cual le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la productividad  y su ganancias, estas las invierte en los gastos básicos  del  hogar; el crédito otorgado de Kiva fue de mucha utilidad, ya que los ingresos han mejorado y el grupo familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en: Jubentino needs to make an investment because he will start the new planting of basic grains. That is why he is asking for a new loan. He will use it to buy the necessary agricultural materials, such as fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and more. The previous loan helped him to increase productivity and his earnings, which he invests in basic household expenses. The loan he was given with Kiva was very useful to him, since his income has improved and his family group is the same.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition payments and graduation expenses for her Masters Degree.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 36-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has two young children. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish and crab to earn a living. He has been into fishing for almost five years.

To improve his fishing activity, Renato requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and crab nets, to augment his income. In the future, Renato would like to expand his fishing business to become more successful and to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and crab nets

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar, con quien trabaja en sus terrenos cultivo y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo Aldair una mejor vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Marcela trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, por eso siembra semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en los mercados más cercanos de su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marcela, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Marcela is 42 years old. She is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Omar. She works with him on her cropland and together they want to be able to bring their beloved son Aldair a better life. By working hard together every day on their crops. Marcela is trying to change the life she has now. That is why every semester she plants beans, corn, sweet corn and gladiolas. She sells them in the markets closet to her town. What she likes the most about her job is protecting her crops from pests. She has been doing this activity for 19 years and and she thinks the hardest thing is taking her crops to the markets where she sells them, because the sacks are very heavy. This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she feels that this loan will be very beneficial in her financial growth. She promises to make her payments on time. Marcela will invest the S/.1,500 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin is from the village of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Genalin is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a pick-up transport service. She has been engaged in her business for  three years and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities. Aside from this, she also operates a general store to earn extra income.

In 2011, Genalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional items like dried fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like dried fish to sell

loans.name: Robertito

texts.en:
Robertito is a 42-year-old single man from Talibon, Bohol. He is engaged in fishing. He sells fish to earn a livelihood. He has been selling fish for more than 10 years.

To be able to uplift his fishing activity,  he requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase paint and repair the motorboat, which is very important in making his daily livelihood. In the future, Robertito would like to improve his fishing business to be able to save for the future and buy a new motorboat.

loans.use: to purchase paint and repair the motorboat

loans.name: Pdt. Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus is a 41-year-old pastor who is married to Debora, 36 years old. They have 4 children: Richeards, 17 years old; Dion, 16 years old, both are Theological High School students; Victor, 9 years old; and Iren, 6 years old, are both Elementary School students.  

Petrus established a poultry husbandry business in 2004 which is three meters away from his house using his own capital in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. Other than being a pastor and also a teacher, he also grows crops such as tomatoes, vegetables, onions, watermelons, chilis, etc. and has developed a primary school over these past four years to help the children around the neighborhood to get an education. 

A year ago, Petrus and his wife established a kiosk business at their house. Since their business needs a larger space, they’ve planned to build a kiosk between their house and the school, Petrus applied for an individual loan from TLM in amount of IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be spent to build the kiosk and to complete his children's tuition. He hopes that the kiosk income will getting better so it will enable him to repay the loan to TLM right on time.

loans.use: to build a kiosk and to complete his children's tuition

loans.name: Ilusiones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILUSIONES”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cielo es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de blusas, artesanía en macramé, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de manzanas acarameladas, venta de llantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cielo es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; este negocio lo emprendió con el primer préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer ya que este negocio le ayudo a realizar sus estudios superiores.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras por mayor de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para sostener sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ILUSIONES" is starting its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office in Villa Exaltación. The group has eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Cielo is the president. The members run a variety of businesses, including selling blouses, macramé handicrafts, caramel apples, and tires. 

The loan requested will benefit small micro-businesses of which Cielo is a member. Cielo points out that she joined Pro Mujer three loan cycles ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling cosmetics; she started this business with her first loan through Pro Mujer and it helped her to pursue higher education. 

The current loan will be used to increase her capital (to purchase cosmetics wholesale) which she will obtain from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto. She will then sell them to special order. This type of work allows Cielo to earn money to fund her studies. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that likes the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia, vive con su familia, su mama de 65 años de edad y sus dos hijas de 29 y 30 años de edad, todos trabajan en el negocio cada día. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, lo realiza desde hace 8 años, lo desempeña todos los días y no posee horario establecido.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar ropa americana para damas y niñas, tales como: faldas, camisas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, entre otros.  Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener más fortalecido el negocio, incrementar la mercadería para ofrecerles a los clientes.
Su sueño es que su negocio sea reconocido en todo el pueblo y que sus hijas continúen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her family, her mother who is 65 years old, and her two daughters who are 29 and 30 years old, all of whom work in the business every day. Silvia has been selling American clothing for eight years; she works every day and doesn't have a fixed schedule. 

The loan that she is currently requesting will allow her to purchase American clothing for women and girls, such as skirts, shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, suits, among other things. This investment will help her to strengthen her business and to offer more merchandise to her customers. 

Silvia's dream is that her store be renowned throughout the whole village, and that her daughters continue their university studies.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, suits, among other things.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 29 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a married man, and responsible for two children. He works hard so that he can improve his family's situation. 

Walid has been managing a phone accessories business;  he started with a small amount of capital. He would like to expand his business to increase his profit. 

He has requested a youth loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to buy phone accessories to sell at his business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open other phone accessory businesses. 

He thanks Kiva lenders for funding him for his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Sharifu, who is in her mid 30s, is divorced from her husband. She left with a family of seven children, four boys and three girls, one of whom is in school. 

For six years now, she has been managing her family by running a fruits and vegetable business, commonly known as genge. Sharifu works from 7am to 8pm daily, and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This is Sharifu's 20th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania; she will use it to replenish more genge items. She paid all the previous loans successfully, and she managed to buy more business items like fruit, vegetables, bundles of onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. With the business profit, she built a family house, and covered home expenses and school fees. 

Sharifu is working hard to meet her family requirements. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a three-wheel motorbike.
 
Sharifu will share this loan with her group," Mkombozi Mwenge", which consists of 7 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more genge (fruits and vegetables) items.

loans.name: Annabelle Gisella

texts.es:
Annabelle  tiene 38  años de edad, es casada, tiene  dos  hijos,  convive con su esposo e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Annabelle se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, cacao, maracuyá y cría de gallinas y chanchos. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y a menor preco.  Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  cada semana.   Su sueño es tener un terreno propio. Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta controlar los deberes de sus hijos.
texts.en: Annabelle is 38 years old and married, with two children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas region of the province of Los Rios.  The group is called VRC Avanza, and its members work in agriculture.  They all live in the Aguas Frias area, having practically grown up in this region.  Most of them work in agriculture or livestock-raising. Annabelle grows corn, cocoa and passion fruit, and raises chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy fertilizer at a lower price, paying in cash.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas every week.  Her dream is to own her own land.  Her challenge is competition.  In her free time she likes to monitor her children's homework.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Since 2010, Mariam has been trading women’s clothing and underwear from her house in Armavir town. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and son. Mariam purchases inventory for sale from Yerevan and sells it in her town. Over these three years of hard work, Mariam has managed to gain many customers, who prefer to purchase clothing and other products from Mariam only.

Now, in order to create comfortable conditions and meet her clients' needs, Mariam needs financial support to buy new supplies. Mariam has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. Her loan requests are rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Mariam has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Mariam hopes that Kiva lenders will help her to continue her small business which brings income to her family.

loans.use: to buy new women's clothing and underwear to sell to customers

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 48  años de edad, es soltera, tiene un  hijo,  convive con su  hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Rosa   se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, cacao y cría de gallinas y chanchos. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  cada semana.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. Su desafío es la competencia.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old, single, and has a son. She lives together with her son in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "VRC Avanza". Its members work in agriculture and all live in the area of Recinto Aguas Frías. Almost all of them have grown up in that area, and the majority work in agriculture or livestock grazing. 

Rosa works in agriculture and grows corn and cacao. She also raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, agricultural supplies, and manures. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers. She makes her purchases in Ventanas each week. Her dream is to see her business grow. Her challenge is competition. In her free time she likes to get together with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, agricultural supplies and manures.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 43-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol and the father of five children. Alexander has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business locally known as "habal-habal" for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Alexander is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts. With this, he will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle, thus allowing him to use it to transport passengers.

In the future, Alexander hopes to make his business a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, he wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
A psychologist due to his educational background, Artur has held training sessions on conflict resolution and has held private personal training sessions with students since 2010. 

He lives in Armavir town with his daughter and wife, who helps Artur to hold the training. Being very professional in the work that he is doing, Artur has students who value his hard and devoted work very much. 

Artur has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but his loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Artur with purchasing a printer, fax machine, projector and books for training; thus, he will be able to provide better service to his students.

loans.use: to pay for a printer, fax machine, projector and books for his conflict-resolution and private personal training sessions.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She states that what is most enjoyable to her about farming is "feeding my dairy cow." Her biggest challenge is labor. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Karina.'

Peninah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied "because of farming."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Saving culture."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Peninnah replied that it will "pay children's school fees."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peninah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Milas' Group

texts.en:
Milas, 39, is married with two dependent children who are both still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. The main source of her family’s income is from growing cassava in her village. She has been running her business for 10 years, earning about KHR 27,000 per day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Milas received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, four cycles ago and has used it effectively to sustain her family’s business. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Milas, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sreyneath's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneath is aged 24 and married. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. Living in a village of the Ponhea Krek district, Sreyneath has been farming cassava and rice for six years. She can earn about 12,000 KHR (Cambodian riels)  per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sreyneath has never been with VisionFund before. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rwitsiru Bakyala Twimukye Tukore Group

texts.en:
Annet, a young lady with two children, is married. She stays in rural Lyantonde, where she rears goats to meet the family's needs. She also sells milk to add as additional income to the small income from goats. She will use the loan to buy baby goats that she will rear and later sell when they have grown and fattened in the next three months to increase her family income. 

She is hardworking and wants to grow the number of her goats to as many as possible. Annet wants to thank Kiva for getting interested in their businesses and partnering with them.

loans.use: To buy goats for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 27 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She runs a small stall in town which sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for more than seven years. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables. The challenges that she faces in the business is the seasons and competition from other traders. The income that she raises from the loan will pay school fees for her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Salama, a member of WHITE group, has been running a retail shop selling dry foods, soft drinks and cosmetics. She is doing all of these activities in the same business place. Salama is in her early 30s and married with two boys who are in school. She has been in her business since 2009. She works from 6:00am to 9:30pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This will be Salama's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more food items like soft drinks, flour etc. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she bought more shop items. Salama's profit is used to pay for school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day will able to own a big business. 

This loan will be shared by Salama  and her loan group "WHITE" which totals 7 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items like soft drinks, flours etc.

loans.name: Yasmin Aracely

texts.es:
Yasmin, es una mujer soltera y vive con sus hermanos, ella se dedica a la venta de sandilla; negocio que lo aprendió de familia, ella  cuenta que para realizar la venta del producto  sale de su casa desde las 7:00 a.m. y regresa pasada las 5:00 p.m. 
Ella  solicita el crédito para poder realizar la compra de más producto para su comercialización y de esa manera aprovechar la temporada de la fruta (Sandilla) y así poder obtener mayores ingresos.
Yasmin, sueña con poder reparar su vivienda y tener un vehículo propio que le permita trasladarse con su producto.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a single woman, and she lives with her siblings. She works selling watermelon; she learned the business from her family. She says that in order to sell her product, she leaves her house at 7:00 a.m. and returns after 5:00 p.m. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more products for her business, and in this way take advantage of the fruit season (watermelon) and therefore get better earnings.

Yasmin hopes to be able to renovate her home and to have her own vehicle that will allow her to move around with her products.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has two children and has been doing this work for 15 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is the high returns. His biggest challenge is lack of capital and high input prices. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Wamaitha."

Cyrus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because Juhudi is giving loans to farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. He said, "Microfinance gives loans with a minimal collateral requirement."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Cyrus replied that he will be able to educate his children and to improve their living standards.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cyrus owns a cow, poultry and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV and DVD in the household but does not have electricity or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Alpaquitas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPAQUITAS II”  iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: atención de internet, material es colar, tienda de barrio, taller de costura, venta de leche, venta de dulces, venta de CD’s, costura de ropa para niños, costura de mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo emprendió desde niña, ya que fue un negocio familiar y cuando tuvo a sus hijos decide implementar su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de estantes) que adquirirá de lo tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo y después de realizar el producto lo distribuirá a los comerciantes minoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Alpaquitas II” (Little Alpacas II) will begin its nineteenth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of the town of Exaltación. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, where María Elena is the president. 

The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are Internet services, school supplies, a neighborhood store, a sewing shop, milk sales, candy sales, CD sales, sewing children’s clothing, and sewing aprons. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses, one of which María Elena belongs to. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago at the invitation of her friend who is a partner in the organization. 

Currently, she has a sewing shop; she has been doing this work since she was a girl. Since this was familiar work, when she had her children, she decided to open up her own space to work. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by purchasing shelving that she will get from stores in the city of El Alto. Then, she will install them in her workspace; after making her products, she will distribute them to retail merchants. This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the educational training area for credit and health.

loans.use: to purchase shelving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do electrical rewiring in his home

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos  para quienes dedica el fruto de su trabajo. Posee una vivienda hecha a base de madera donde vive junto a su familia. Se dedica a la producción y mantenimiento de productos agrícolas como el cacao, barbasco y café orgánico, se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años en unas parcelas que adquirió cuando era joven junto al padre de sus hijos aprovechando una oferta por parte de un familiar suyo, tiene el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar que contrata periódicamente ya sea para el retiro de maleza y cosecha de los productos.Considera que su trabajo es uno de los más abnegados y la vez  remunerativo ya que obtiene buenos resultados por sus productos.Actualmente se encuentra iniciando una nueva campaña productiva y desea contar con dinero suficiente para la compra de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo  así como herramientas para desempeñar sus labores sin complicaciones. Día a día se levanta muy temprano con el objetivo de lograr a futuro la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad y construir una vivienda para el futuro bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children, to whom she dedicates the fruit of her labor. She has a wooden home where she lives with her family. 

She makes a living in the production and maintenance of agricultural products such as cocoa, barbasco and organic coffee, She has done this for 10 years. She acquired plots of land when she was young, with the father of her children, taking advantage of an offer from a family member. She has the support of local workers who she periodically hires to remove weeds and harvest the crops. She believes that her job is one of the most self-sacrificing and at the same time rewarding, since she gets good results for her products. 

She is currently starting a new growing season and wants to have enough money to buy organic fertilizer for the land, as well as tools to carry out their work without complications. 

Every day she gets up very early with the goal to one day purchase a plot of land in the city and build a home for the future well-being of her children. 

This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to continue forward. Furthermore, she promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner. At this time she asks for 1,500 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Oswaldo Rodolfo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene  33  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene cuatro  hijos,  convive con su esposa e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Oswaldo   se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de gallinas y chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y amenor precio. 

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  cada semana.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.

Su desafío es la competencia.
En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia y hacer deportes.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 33 years old. He is married and he has four children. He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. 

The name of the communal bank is Avanza and its members make a living from agriculture. All of the members live in the area of Aguas Frías. They have practically grown up in this zone. They mostly make a living from farm work or working with livestock. 

Oswaldo makes a living from agriculture. He sows corn and he tends to hens and pigs. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizer, supplies, and compost.

With the support of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizers at a lower price with cash. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each week. His dream is for his business to grow.

His challenge is the competition.

In his free time he likes to get together with his family and play sport.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, supplies, and compost

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамаре 45 лет, замужем. Имеет четверых детей. У Тамары средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Тамара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному трудуТамары, она смогла развить и и увеличить поголовье скота, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 20 овец. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Тамаре открыть торговую точку. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тамара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку школьной формы для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также дать достойное образование детям.
texts.en:
Tamara is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a specialized secondary education.  She gets very good reviews from her neighbors who describe her as a kind and hardworking woman.

Tamara has been involved in animal husbandry since 1990, thus providing her family with its main source of income.   She started in this business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, she has managed to develop her activity and increase her livestock headcount.  She now owns 20 sheep and makes close to 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which are essentially used to cover her family's food expenses as well as their daily needs. 

With the income from her business, Tamara has opened a retail outlet.  In order to further develop this activity, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy school uniforms for resale.

Tamara plans to invest her earnings from this loan into further increasing her business.  She also plans to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 30  años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos  hijos,  convive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

José  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de gallinas y chanchos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Mocache  cada semana.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. 

Su desafío es la competencia.
