En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deportes y participar en la pelea de gallos.
texts.en:
José, 30, is single and has two children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, De los Ríos province. The name of the communal bank is VRC Avanza; its members work in agriculture and farming and live in a village called Aguas Frías. Most of them were born and raised in this region.

José works in agriculture, growing corn and raising chickens and pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, compost and other supplies. With this loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers. He buys these supplies in Mocache, every week. His dream is to expand his business. His challenge is competition. In his spare time, he likes to play sports and go to cockfights.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and other supplies.

loans.name: Nélida Elcy

texts.es: Nélida, a sus 23 años es casada y aún no tiene hijos. Nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las actividades agropecuarias y el cuidado de los animales, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre. Actualmente se dedica a estudiar Artes Plásticas y está en quinto semestre, esta actividad la alterna con la cría de gallinas ponedoras, pues posee un galpón ubicado en la finca donde reside, cuya producción diaria es vendida en la plaza de mercado y a los familiares y vecinos del sector, con esto ha generado ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para el pago de sus estudios. Nélida es una joven enérgica, juiciosa, activa, responsable y tiene proyección hacia el futuro, siempre va buscando opciones que le permitan avanzar; por esta razón solicita su segundo ciclo de crédito, que invertirá en la compra de más animales (pollos y conejos) y concentrado para los animales (cuido) con esto podrá tener más variedad de animales para la venta y podrá aprovechar los grandes espacios que tiene disponibles para el cuidado de los mismos; esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos por ventas y tendrá la posibilidad de cumplir uno de sus principales sueños que es culminar sus estudios y poder continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida en un mediano plazo.
texts.en: Nélida is 23 years old and married. She does not have any children yet. She was born in the countryside and grew up there, where she learnt agricultural work and how to look after the animals thanks to her mother’s lessons. She is currently studying Fine Arts and is in her fifth semester. She also raises laying hens. She has a shed on the farm where she lives and the eggs are sold daily in the marketplace and to family members and neighbours in the area. By doing this she has generated income to support the household economy and to pay for her studies. Nélida is an energetic, wise, active, and responsible young woman with plans for the future. She is always looking for ways to advance; for this reason she is requesting a second loan, which she will invest in purchasing more animals (chickens and rabbits) and animal feed. She will thereby be able to have a greater variety of animals to sell and will be able to take advantage of the large spaces she has available for their care. This will be reflected in an increase of income through sales and she will have the possibility of fulfilling one of her main dreams, which is to finish her studies and be able to continue contributing to the economy of her home in order to have a better quality of life in a few years.

loans.use: to buy more animals (chickens and rabbits) and animal feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia  is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story: 
My name is Virginia and I am 56 years old. I live with my family in a house in Mexico City.  I have been selling beauty products, imitation jewelry and notions for 20 years already. My store is located on a market. In my store, I sell products and I offer weaving classes to people interested.
I will use this loan to purchase goods such as shoes and backpacks for the Back to School season. In this way, I am hoping to increase sales and therefore, increase profits. My biggest accomplishments are sending my children off to college and giving them a good quality of life. I believe I am a responsible person and I don’t like being late on my payments.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as shoes and backpacks for the Back to School season

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. У нее один ребенок. Людмила имеет свой собственный бизнес.
Людмила занимается продажей посуды более 10 лет. Она арендует место в универмаге города. 

Людмила имеет репутацию хорошего, порядочного и ответственного человека. Она хочет развивать бизнес и увеличивать прибыль. Людмила заботится о своей семье и помогает материально детям. 

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку товара: набор кастрюль, тарелок, чайников и скатертей.
texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has one child. Ludmila has her own business. She sells dishware for over ten years. She rents out a space in the town's covered market.

Ludmila has a reputation of a good, decent and responsible person. She wants to grow her business and increase profits. Ludmila takes care of her family and helps children financially.

Ludmila is asking to provide her with a loan in the amount 10,000 hryvna to buy inventory such as cook pan sets, dishes, teapots and tablecloths.

loans.use: to purchase inventory: cook pan sets, teapots, dishes and tablecloths.

loans.name: Adil Roldan

texts.es: Adil, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Trinidad, Santa Barbara. El aprendió a confeccionar zapatos donde trabajo por varios años, ahora lleva más de 8 años  de tener su propio taller de zapatería donde confecciona los zapatos y los vende. Fabrica zapato colegial, tenis, tacos, y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el quinto ciclo y es por 21,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como plantillas, suela, hilos, pegamento etc. para la fabricación  de calzado de todo tipo. El tiene como meta  tener varios talleres de zapatería, también poder elaborar todo tipo de calzado para obtener mayores ingresos y poder estar siempre con su familia.
texts.en: Adil is 40 years old and married. He has two sons and lives in a village in the area of Trinidad, Santa Barbara. He learned to make shoes at the place where he worked for many years, and has had his own workshop for over eight years, where he sells the shoes he makes. He makes all sorts of shoes: school shoes, sports shoes, heeled shoes, etc. This is his fifth loan with the field partner. Adil asks for 21,000 lempiras in order to buy supplies such as interior and exterior soles, thread, glue, and other items, which he will use to make shoes of all kinds. His goal is to own several workshops one day and to diversify his production even more, all in the hopes of increasing his income so as to always stand by his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Bidossessi 3 Group

texts.fr: BIDOSSESSI 3 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Régina (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Régina est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et un reste à sa charge.  Régina vit seule avec son enfant restant à sa charge et assure seule ses différents besoins, grâce aux revenus issus de son activité. Depuis près de dix ans, Régina vend des foyers en argile. Parallèlement, Régina vend de la bouillie de maïs et de soja dans sa région. Régina s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Régina et les autres membres du groupe BIDOSSESSI 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Bidossessi 3 is a group of 4 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Régina (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 41 years old and doesn't live with her husband any more. Régina is the mother of 3 children, some of whom attend school and one of whom remains under her care. Régina lives alone with the child she is raising and meets the child's different needs by herself, thanks to the income she gets from her business. Régina has been selling clay ovens for nearly 10 years. She also sells maize and soya porridge in her area. She gets her supplies in Benin. This is the third time that Régina and the other group members are requesting the financial support of ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and strengthen their businesses, so that they can better respond to their customer demand. The 2 previously received loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy clay ovens, maize, soya, etc.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: YELIAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Célia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Célia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Célia assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Célia vend des sacs de riz et de l'huile de palme dans sa région. Célia s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Célia et les autres membres du groupe YELIAN sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Yelian is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Célia (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 33 years old and married to Jean. The couple have 4 dependent children, all of whom attend school. Célia lives together with her children and her husband. Célia and her husband both take care of the different household expenses together. Célia has been selling bags of rice and palm oil in her area for nearly 15 years. She gets her supplies in Benin. This is the third time that Célia and the other members of the Yelian group are requesting the financial support of ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and strengthen their businesses, so that they can better respond to their customer demand. The previously received loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and palm oil.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Charlotte est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Zawadi», junior,  entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 28 ans, divorcée et mère d’un enfant  qui étudie. La cliente est vendeuse des chaussettes. Elle installe ses objets au marché et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima,  il y a environ 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 ballons des chaussettes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir son enfant et acheter une parcelle et y construire une belle maison. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il est à noter qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Charlotte, the customer, is an advisor to the business group "Zawadi". A young and dynamic entrepreneur with a lot of experience, she is 28 years old, divorced and the mother of a child who goes to school. Charlotte sells socks. She displays her products at the market and, occasionally, at home. She started her business with a basic loan from the MFI Hemika about 5 years ago. This new loan will be used to buy 2 bales of socks. She would like to increase her business, to feed and educate her child and to buy a plot of land and build a nice house on it. Her lack of sufficient funds is a challenge to the development of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

Note: one of the customers in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of socks.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en:
Gulpari is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Agdam. Now she lives in the Baku region with her family. Gulpari is 53 years old and married with two children, a daughter and a son. Her son goes to school and her daughter goes to a university. Her daughter wants to be a journalist. 

Gulpari started her business selling food seven years ago. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy a refrigerator. She wants to use the profits for her family's future. In the future, Gulpari wants to have a big place in which to sell food. This will ensure her business is more profitable. Gulpari is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Shikar

texts.en:
Shikar is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Kalbadjar city. Now he lives in the Baku region with his family. Shikar is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 daughters and a son. His daughters go to school and his son goes to university. His son wants to be an athlete. 

Shikar started his business 10 years ago to repair and make iron items. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy paint. He wants to use the money for his children's future. In the future, Shikar wants to have a new workplace that will be more profitable for his business. Shikar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy paint

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en:
Elxan is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children, a son and a daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Shusha city. Elxan lives in the Baku region with his family. His daughter goes to school and his son goes to preschool. 

Elxan started his business 2 years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables to make compotes, marinades and jam. His wife helps him at his business.  She make the items and Elxan sells them. He wants to use the profits for his son's and daughter's future. 

In the future, Elxan wants to buy a car to deliver the goods to large stores. This will be more profitable for his business. Elxan is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Kamiyonga Bakyala Kwekulakulanya Group

texts.en: Margulet is age 25 and married with three children who are all in school. She is strategically located in the town center, so that she is able to attract customers who come from different areas of the town. She will buy stock of used clothing with the loan money she receives. This will help to boast the business and therefore increase her profits. She is hardworking and honest, and she urges her fellow women, especially the group members, to be hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Metaqsya

texts.en:
Metaqsya is a baker from Gyumri town. She bakes bread and cookies in her house and her husband sells her products to local shops. Metaqsya is a very hard-working mother of three children.  Together with her husband, she does her best to ensure a better life for their children. 

As a traditional Armenian woman, Metqasya bakes with great love and care thus her cookies and bread are well known among locals. Now, this diligent woman needs some financial support to purchase a  stove. The old one that she owns is very old and it is very difficult for Metaqsya to bake products.

Metaqsya requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Thus, the support of Kiva lenders is very important for Metaqsya to purchase a new stove and continue the production of her tasty cookies.

loans.use: to pay for a stove for making cookies

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена благодарит за предоставленный ей прошлый кредит. Она смогла расшириться - посторить еще одну теплицу. За счет дохода с продаж в прошлом году Елена с мужем купили автомобиль.

В это году Елена планирует сделать центральное отопление для своих теплиц. Она хочет установить один мощный отопительный котел вместо двух старых маленьких. Для этого ей нужен кредит в размере 15,000 гривен. Новый котел будет легче в обслуживании и более экономный. Затраты на отопление снизятся, а следовательно увеличится прибыль и улучшется  благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Elena is thanking for the previous loan that was given to her. She was able to expand and build one more greenhouse. Using the income from the sales last year Elena and her husband bought a car.

This year Elena plans to install central heating for her greenhouses. She wants to install one powerful heating boiler instead of two small old ones. She needs a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna for this purpose. The new boiler will be easier in maintenance and more economical. The costs for heating will go down and by that the profit will increase and the well being of her family will improve.

loans.use: to install new energy saving heating system.

loans.name: Alpacoma Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPACOMA II”  iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tatiana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de sellos, fábrica de ladrillos, venta de menudencias de pollo, chiflera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tatiana es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación mi madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fábrica ladrillera; este negocio lo emprendió desde niña, ya que fue un negocio familiar y cuando tuvo su hijo decide implementar su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno) que adquirirá de los fabricantes de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo para poder distribuir la mercadería a los comerciantes minoristas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “ALPACOMA II” communal bank will start its fifteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, of which Tatiana is the secretary. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling stamps, making bricks, selling chicken giblets and making chifles.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, one of whom is Tatiana. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years, joining at the invitation of her mother, who is a member of the institution. Right now she a has a brick factory. She learned this business as a child, since it was a family business. When she had a child she decided to set up her own workspace.   
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying an kiln. She will buy it from manufacturers in the city of El Alto and later set it up in her workspace to be able to distribute the merchandise to the retailers. This work allows her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, as she is single and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the credit and health trainings.

loans.use: to buy a kiln.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen, at the age of 31, found a means to make a living by providing electrician services. He repairs different type of technical machines and earns income for his family.
 
Armen lives and works in Gyumri town with his wife, 4-year-old son, mother and brother. He works hard to provide high quality service and gain more customers. Unfortunately, the income Armen gathers is hardly enough to cover the family's needs. As a result, there is no money left to invest in the business.

Armen has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but his loan request was rejected every time because the business isn't registered as a formal business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.

The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with easy conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

With the help of the loan Armen will be able to purchase supplies and will be able to continue providing electrician services to customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to provide electrician services to customers

loans.name: Ammer

texts.en: Ammer is a 24-year-old, who lives in Taiz, Yemen. Ammer's business is a small grocery store where he sells basic food materials and soft drinks. He has been in this business for one year. He tends to his customers who come to him every day. Firstly, his mother provided him with money to open a gas cylinder business then he expanded by opening a grocery store. He has applied for a youth loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials from AMB. With this money, he wants to buy grocery materials for his business. With the increased income, he will improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery material for his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, transportation services, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding the cows.' Her biggest challenge is 'Cutting the cow's feed from the farm.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Brown.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They mostly like to deal with groups.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Florence replied 'More time will be created to do more economic work.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'cow, pig, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 40 años soltera y con el orgullo de haber sacado delante a sus 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa hecha de adobe. Cuando cumplió 23 años empezó a trabajar en los terrenos que su ex esposo poseía cultivando los productos mas rentables de la zona como son el cacao orgánico y barbasco. Comenta que al inicio no fue nada fácil trabajar porque no contaba con dinero suficiente para la compra de semillas y abono orgánico los cuales son indispensables para obtener una buena calidad de frutos. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de cultivo donde tiene más plantaciones de barbasco ya que el suelo que poseen sus parcelas favorecen a obtener una buena calidad de estos productos. Para el retiro y posterior venta de las raíces contrata a trabajadores del lugar quienes con mucho cuidado desentierran los tallos y envuelven con cuerdas hechas a base cáscara de troncos para que sean trasladados a la ciudad donde se ubican los centros de venta sin perder sus propiedades ya  que finalmente son usados para la fabricación de insecticidas naturales y otros derivados comerciales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y realizar la cosecha con 4 cuadras de barbasco que suele realizar periódicamente.
texts.en:
Adela is a 40 year old single woman who is proud to have gotten her 3 children ahead. She lives with them in her adobe house. When she turned 23, she started to work on land that her ex-husband had, growing the most profitable products in the area, such as organic cacao and barbasco. She says that at first it wasn't easy at all because she didn't have enough money to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, things that are necessary to  obtain a good quality fruit. Right now, she has 3 hectares of crops where she grows barbasco, since the soil on her land is favorable for obtaining a good quality of that products.  To harvest and latter sell the roots, she hires laborers from the area who very carefully dig up the stalks and wrap them in cords made from tree bark so they can be transported to the sales centers without losing their properties. They are used to make natural insecticide and for other commercial purposes. This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting to keep going ahead. She is committed to making her payments on time.

She would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers and harvest four fields of barbasco, which she does periodically.

loans.use: to hire laborers from the area.

loans.name: Laura Magdalena

texts.es:
Laura tiene 28  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos  hijos,  convive con su esposo e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Laura   se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de gallinas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  cada semana.  

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is 28 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton, province of   Los Ríos. 

The communal bank is called Avanza. Its members work in agriculture. All of them live in the area of the community Aguas Frías. They have practically grown up in the area. They work mainly in agriculture or with livestock. 

Laura works in agriculture. She grows corn and raises chickens. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and other materials. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizer. She does her purchasing in Ventanas every week. Her dream is for her business to grow and her challenge is the competition. In her free time, she likes to get together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and other materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter Kamau is 60 years old, from Nyandarua South and is married with grown-up children.

Peter is a farmer and has been in it for the past 8 years. He has applied for his seventh loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings, and also to pay for labour.

He hopes to be able to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been trading women’s clothing and underwear in Spitak town and its neighboring villages. For purchasing the inventory that she sells, Lilit goes 3 times a month to Yerevan town, purchases needed supplies and sells to locals.

Lilit lives in Spitak town with her two school-age children (her daughter is in the photo). It is very difficult for Lilit to sustain her family alone, but due to her hard work over 5 years, she was able to grow her children up. As the income she gathers is hardly enough for covering the family's costs, there is no money left for purchasing supplies for selling. Lilit requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business.

Lilit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Lilit will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to purchase supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new clothing supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Don ángel es originario de la ciudad Estelí, tiene 61 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería hace  12 años lo cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrifico ha mantenido activo logrando dar estudio a sus hijos quienes son profesionales e independientes, tiene como apoyo a su esposa quien se dedica al servicio de la pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, maíz, azúcar, aceite, pasta dental, papel higiénico etc. con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y surtir su negocio con la  expectativa de prosperar siendo líder en el mercado. Su meta futuro es aumentar sus ingresos y tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Angel is originally from the city of Estelí. He is a 61-year-old married man with 4 children. He has had his own grocery store for 12 years. During that time, he has worked hard and sacrificed to be able to pay for his children's studies. They are now independent working professionals. He is supported by his wife, who also works at the grocery store. He is seeking a loan in order to buy products such as rice, corn, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and toilet paper, among other things, so as to meet his customers' demands and stock his store. He hopes that his business will prosper and become the leading local store. His goal for the future is to increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sugar, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Finding feeds for his goats.' His biggest challenge is 'Milking goats.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Brown.'

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'Groups guarantee each other's loans.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Peter replied 'More goats will lead to more income therefore improving the living standard of the family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following: 'cow, goats, pig, poultry, pump and motorcycle' but does not own 'bicycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water or sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 38-year-old, married father of three in Thika, runs a general store. He currently lacks enough funds to purchase stock to serve his evergrowing customer base.

With a loan through KADET Ltd., Stephen will be able to purchase more iron sheets, paint, cement, plumbing machines and tiles. Stephen is requesting his sixth loan from KADET Ltd. having completely repaid all his previous loans successfully. The additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. In the future, Stephen would like to invest in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more iron sheets, paint, cement, plumbing machines and tiles as stock for his general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old and has five children who are in school. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 18 years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She repaid her previous loan on time. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future she hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan, along with his family, lives in the village Gargar, which is in Lori region. He is 36 years old. Vachagan is married and he lives with his wife, two children and retired parents. He works as a locksmith in their village and he has shift work.

Simultaneously to his work, Vachagan has been engaged in beekeeping for the past 15 years.  His parents help him very much in the beekeeping activities and, as a result of their hard and honest work, they manage to have the sweetest and the purest honey in their village. Vachagan owns sixty beehives on his farm and at the same time he also breeds a cow, a calf and a piglet. Vachagan’s father is mainly engaged in land cultivation and they use the vegetables and fruits of their garden for their family.

Vachgan has decided to develop his farming as well and he asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and cows to develop his farm and thus increase his family's income

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 68 years old, married to Isaac, and they have five children who have their own families. She has been in the vegetable selling business for the past one year and has applied for her first loan from Kadet LTD to enable her to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and carrots, among others. She hopes to expand her business by buying still more stock with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Gladys hopes to own the biggest green grocery in Gilgil town.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and carrots, among others.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married to Simon, and they have three children who are in school. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 12 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy fertilizer, chemicals and seeds.She plans to expand her farming business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Esther hopes to expand her dairy farming so as to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 61 years old, married, and blessed with eight children who are now all adults.  He owns a retail shop in Kipkata and has been in operation over a period of 25 years, earning an income of Kes 5,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stock of sugar, washing detergents, and cooking oil among other goods for resale.  The profits he earns will be used to plough back into the business and add more stock.

His dream is to venture into wholesale supply.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, detergents, and cooking oil, among other goods

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis juillet 2007.,il est composé de membres issus du même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Celle qui léve son bras sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 42 ans,elle est veuve et mére de 04 enfants dont  02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de vêtements,elle fait ce type de vente depuis des années ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une clientéle qui lui est fidéle.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des tissus pour une valeur de 136500f et 200000f pour couvrir les frais scolaires de son fils étudiant.

Elle compte assurer les besoins de sa famille,la scolarité des enfants,leur nourriture et leur frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This group exists since July 2007 and is made up of members of the same neighbourhood who all work in commerce

The person who has her hand raised in the photograph is the leader of the group. She is a 42 year old widow with four children, two of which are girls.

Her business is clothing, she has been in this activity for some years which is why her customers are faithful to her.

With her loan she plans to buy fabrics worth 136500f and 200000f to cover the education costs for her son, who is a student.

She also plans to pay for her family's needs, her children's school fees, their food and their medical costs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Tarxan

texts.en: Tarxan is 45 years old, married, and has two daughters. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Kalbajdar region of Azerbaijan, who now lives in the Baku region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income, while his daughters go to school. Tarxan started his taxi business two years ago. Unfortunately, as you can see in the photo, Tarxan has been involved in an accident. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to repair his car. In the future, he wants to buy a new car as this will be more profitable for his business. Tarxan is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma,  es una persona trabajadora, tiene 52 años de edad y dos hijos,  vive con su nieta, la cual tiene cinco años de edad. Ella, posee una tienda en su casa, la cual esta surtida y trabaja todos los días, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de primera necesidad, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, huevos, sal, jabón, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking woman. She is 52 years old, has 2 children and lives with her 5-year-old granddaughter. She has a well-stocked store in her home, where she has worked every day for the last 10 years.
The loan she is seeking will allow her to buy basic provisions such as beans, rice, sugar, eggs, salt and soap, among other items. This investment will help her build her inventory and increase her revenues.
Her dream is to strengthen her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, eggs, salt and soap, among other items.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Narek, at the age of 23, found a means to make a living by providing taxi service to locals. He lives in Vanadzor town with his mother and grandmother. Although Narek is young, he is already a very skilled driver and knows each place in town.

Unfortunately Narek's car broke down a month ago and he wasn't able to repair it because of financial difficulties. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but his loan request was rejected every time because the business isn't registered as a formal business.

Narek has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With this new initiative Narek is very motivated to repair his car, purchase tires and be able to continue his taxi business.

Narek waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs on his taxi and purchase tires

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 35 years old, married to Priscilla who is a farmer, and they have three children who are in school.

He has been in the transport business in Naivasha for the past five years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a cow. With anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

Duncan hopes to own a minibus in the near future so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds for maize and other crops

loans.name: Diary's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 29 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes et d'arachide,elle a une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis sa jeunesse.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter de l'arachide pour une valeur de 20000f et des légumes pour une valeur de 175000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2009. It is made up of people who live in the same neighbourhood and who work in commerce.

The person on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group, she is 29 and married with seven children.

Her activity is the sale of vegetables and groundnuts, she has much experience in this business as she has been doing it since she was young.

With her loan she plans to buy 20000f worth of groundnuts and 175000f worth of vegetables.

Her aim is to pay the school fees for her children and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Balakarim

texts.en:
Balakarim is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Baku region. Balakarim is married and has four children: three daughters and a son. 

Balakarim started his business four years ago to sell fruits and vegetables. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Balakarim wants to have a place for selling; this will be more profitable for his business. Balakarim is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fernando Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene cuatro  hijos,  convive con su esposa e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Fernando  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de chanchos, gallinas, patos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  y  Mocache cada semana.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. 

Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 39 years old. He has four children and lives in a civil union. He lives with his spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, in Provincia de los Ríos. 

He is a member of VRC AVANZA. The members of this group are all farmers who live the Recinto Aguas Frías area.
They grew up in this region and the majority earn a living working in agriculture or with livestock.

Fernando earns a living in agriculture, planting corn and raising pigs, hens and ducks. 

He is seeking this loan in order to buy manure, fertilizers and supplies. 

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers.  

He will make these purchases in Ventanas and Mocache on a weekly basis. His dream is for his business to grow.

His obstacle is the competition.  

In his free time, he likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is very grateful to Kiva lenders for providing her with her previous loan, which significantly improved her business. She is now seeking another loan to buy more second hand clothes, handbags and shoes, in order to attract more customers. Grace lives in the Kilifi area, north of Mombasa in Kenya. She is 50 years old and a married mother of four. She has been in her business for four years now and it is her only source of income. The major challenges she faces are customers not paying on time and the high cost of fuel. She has a vision to open a boutique in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en:
Nexhmije is married and mother of five children between the ages of 1 and 8 years old. She is a housewife, staying home to care for the children and the house, but sometimes helps her husband sell wood for heating during the wintertime. They live in very poor conditions in the Ashkali community of Kosovo. Her husband earns a living by using his horse to transport and collect both wood and iron, which he then sells in the community. 

Nexhmije is now requesting a loan in order to renovate the roof for the horse’s stable. The stable is in need of renovation because it is very old and when it rains the horse and the area become wet and even flooded. Nexhmije’s goal is to add a cow to their stable and then be able to sell the milk and dairy products to add extra income for their family. She wants to thank all lenders for this support!

loans.use: To renovate the roof for the stable of the horse they use to transport loads

loans.name: Abdulghany

texts.en: Abdulghany is 29 years old, and is married man who has three children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a goods distributor; that is how he makes the effort to provide for himself and his family. His family is proud of him because he is a person who faced the difficult situations that happened to him. He intends to buy furniture for his house, but he doesn't have enough money, so he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture. He wishes to improve his living standards and build the second floor of his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is a taxi driver from the village of Arjut, where he lives with his wife and a little son. He has been providing a taxi service in his own car for four years. As the only breadwinner in the family, Telman works really hard to make enough income to meet his family's needs. Now, his car needs to be serviced, and the tires should be changed, but Telman has no money to do that. 

Telman has asked for a loan from local financial institutions several times, but his request has been rejected each time because his business is not formally registered. 

Telman has now been approved for a loan by a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to regular credit products.

This loan is very important for Telman to service his the car, replace his tires and be able to continue his business which is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the servicing of his car and the replacement of his tires

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is a small scale petty trader who sells vegetables and food items in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a contractor. Matilda has been working with vegetables and food items  for close to five months. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables and food items, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a vegetables and provisions stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables and food items, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to a mechanic. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a primary school graduate, Gladys used to be a hair dresser but currently sells provisions in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over eight years of experience in this trade, Gladys sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.  

Gladys wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provision enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Janet is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling  frozen fish in Whindo (near  Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Janet is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of frozen fish. 

In the long term, Janet plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of frozen fish.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Mariama, who lives in West Point in Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known marketplaces in Montserrado county. She boasts of her high school diploma, and she said she is good at managing her home and business affairs. She is married to a security man, and they have a 13-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home. 

For the past years, she has been selling soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice in the local market. The problem she faces is sometimes slow buying, but most of the time she realizes a profit, and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a security guard; they have four children aged between 10 and 15 who are in school and living at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past nine years, she has been running a table from which she sells red oil in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she learned this way of trading from her friends. She started this business with money from her husband, and by means of taxi, she transports her goods to her shop every time.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She plans to buy a pieces of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 34 years old and lives in the West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She and her fiancee are living together with three children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of her kids are going to school. She is a grade-five dropout, and learned some business skills from friends. Her fiancee is a barber; notwithstanding that, she manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 

Over the past three years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her fiancee. She sells from the table for six days every week, spending nine hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm nuts, potatoes, greens, etc., for her business. She is happy to share her information with the lenders of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more palm nuts, potatoes, greens, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 41 years old and comes from a location known as Suna Ralaga which is found in Migori county in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Florence who is a business lady too.. Daniel supports four people in his family and has two kids who are 8 and 3 years old.

He sells second-hand clothes, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years, and gets a monthly income of Kes 84,000. He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business and take good care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a 45-year-old man from Usenge region in Siaya county which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports five people in his family. He is married to Mrs. Alice, who is a business lady,

He does small-scale farming growing vegetables. He has been doing this for the last five years and generates a monthly income of Kes 70,000. He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to be able to to provide for his family needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 21 years old. She lives in a city called Artashat, in Armenia. She lives with her parents and sister. 

Jemma has recently graduated from the faculty of International Relations and Public Administration in Yerevan State University. Jemma’s parents are both employed; her father works as a driver and her mother is a teacher at a school. Jemma says that she really enjoyed her degree, but she decided to work in a different field. She chose to work as a cosmetologist, and obtained the highest qualification of cosmetology. She now has a small but very nice office of her own, and nearly all of the modern equipment that she needs for her work. She is well-known and very much trusted as a specialist in her district, and her clients say that she can work wonders with any woman who needs help with their appearance. 

Jemma has asked for a loan of $2,200 to buy a special machine for photo epilation, a service which is in great demand among her clients.

loans.use: to buy special machine for photo epilation for her cosmetology business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school,  Rebecca decided to set up her own cutlery set business in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over four years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her by purchase more cutlery sets for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a craft man) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase more cutlery sets for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet  is a hair dresser who operate this beauty salon in the picture above in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a  primary school  graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.  Janet  has been working as a hair dresser  for close to nine years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of hair creams, hair extensions and hair dryer, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of hair creams, hair extensions and hair dryer.

loans.name: Shawnm

texts.en:
Shawnm is a 32-year-old married Iraqi woman. When Shawnm was a child, her mother taught her how to knit and sew. Shawnm mastered this skill and in 2010, she bought an old machine to assist her husband in providing their family's income. She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood—thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.
Shawnm is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD in order to buy a new sewing machine and fabric to increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing the family income. 
The story of Shawnm and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

She asked to blur her face because she is from a rural area and preferred to have her face altered for cultural reasons.

loans.use: A loan of $1,800 helped Shawnm to buy new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Ngigi

texts.en:
Ngigi is 32 years old. He is married, and blessed with one child who is aged six. His primary business is a spare parts shop in town, which he has run for the last seven years. He also owns a public service vehicle, which transports people within the city, and this provides him with additional income. 

The main challenge he faces is that it takes a large amount of money to add inventory to his spare parts business. Ngigi heard of Milango through friends and has now asked a loan to buy additional spare parts for sale. The income generated by the loan will improve his living standards and help to educate his family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts

loans.name: Cartald

texts.en:
Cartald is 34 years old, and is blessed with one child. He works as a driver, and a year ago he started running a cereals shop in the Changamwe area as an additional business. Cartald is employing someone else to run the cereal business in his place. 

Cartald knew about Milango through friends, and he has now asked for a loan to buy bags of maize, rice and beans for sale. The major problem for his business is when he incurs losses. It then becomes very difficult to run the business smoothly. In five years time he would like to be running a successful wholesale shop dealing in cereals. The extra income generated by the loan will pay for his child’s school fees, and will help to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy bags pf maize, rice and beans

loans.name: Patricial

texts.en: Patricial lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county.  She is 26 years old,  single, with a one year-old child who lives at home.  For three years now she has been operating a table market in the community market selling rice by the cup, pepper, oil, onions, etc.  She received a little amount from her mother to start her business, and learned it from her.  She likes her business because she makes a profit.  She is  requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag, pepper, oil, onions, etc., to increase her  business.  Her future plan is to make her business bigger. She wants to thank the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag, pepper, oil, onions, etc. to increase her  business,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a small-scale petty trader who sells vegetables in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary school  graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a construction worker.  Matilda has been working as a vegetable dealer for close to four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a vegetable stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of vegetables.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is divorced and has two children. After successfully graduating primary, Francisca is now an established businesswoman. She sells ice kenkey and bread in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 3three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family,  Francisca  uses her income to provide for the entire family.  Francisca will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of flour to bake her bread and kenkey to prepare her ice kenkey, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Francisca plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: increased amounts of flour to bake her bread and kenkey to prepare her ice kenkey

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya owns a small business. She sells men's and women's shoes. Nataliya has been in this business for 17 years. She has many repeat clients that buy from her when they need a new pair of shoes. 

Nataliya is getting ready for the fall season. She needs to increase her assortment to be able to give her clients a larger variety to choose from. Nataliya is asking for a loan of UAH 5,000. 

Nataliya's business is the main source of income for her family. Her husband is retired and helps Nataliya in her business, as needed.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell in the upcoming fall season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet 50-year-old Ruth from Liberia.  She lives in the area of Paynesville South, which is one of the densely populates areas in Montserrado County.  Ruth is a widow and attended and finished grade school. Ruth has five children, but only two of her children are attending grade school and live at home with her. 

Ruth manages her business well in order to sustain her family.  For the past two years she has been selling 'red oil' in the local market. For now she faces no problem, and she sells for six days a week, spending ten hours on her business. She started this business with a little money from her savings.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more 'red oil' for her business. She hopes to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more 'red oil' for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Elizabeth operates a chop bar (a restaurant where African dishes are sold)  in Whindo  (near Takoradi). She has been doing so for about two years. As a widow with three children, she uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of foodstuff and food items, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.  Elizabeth  wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: purchase an increased amount of food stuff and food items, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married to a construction worker.   She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a primary school graduate,  Agnes used to sell eggs but currently sells provisiona in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over one year of experience in this trade,  Agnes sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.  Agnes wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provision  enterprise.

loans.use: buy more provisions

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Regina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling frozen chicken in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years.  

Regina is married and has seven children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole bread-winner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Regina  wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of frozen chicken. 

In the long term, Regina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of frozen chicken.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with one child. She received some schooling till the end of junior high school. For the past three years, Joyce has sold flour, salt, gari (cassava flour), and rice in Whindo, near Takoradi. Her husband works as a driver and her income goes toward helping her husband pay for their family's general expenses.   

Joyce is requesting a loan to buy flour, gari, salt, and sugar. With the new profits from her loan, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to buy flour, gari, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Ntuhemuke Group

texts.fr:
Désirée fait partie du groupe  Ntuhemuke et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Dieudonné, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant qui étudie. 
Elle prend soin d’un élève.

Elle fait le commerce du riz et du haricot depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de riz et de haricot,  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle, construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Désirée is a member of the group Ntuhemuke. She lives in Bujumbura. She is married to a merchant named Dieudonné, and they have one child who goes to school. She also looks after a student. 

Désirée has been selling rice and beans for 4 years. This is her 3rd loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the credit to bolster her working capital and to buy many kilos of rice and beans to sell, thus increasing her revenue. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy some land, build a house and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy many kilos of rice and beans to sell, thus increasing her revenue.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en: Lene is back, seeking lenders' financial help again to repair the recently damaged stable of her animals before the end of September.

loans.use: to repair the recently damaged stable

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 34 year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has six children, between 4 and 15.  They are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She has completed grade 11th before starting her business.  She describes herself as hard-working woman.  She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Martha has had a table business which sells oil, flour by the cup, sugar, etc., for the past fifteen years.  She works from 8Am to 5Pm per day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more oil, flour, sugar, etc.  She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house.  She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to buy more oil, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Bai from Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone. He is single and has two children, ages 2 and 5 years.  He began his business because he wants to improve his standard of living and stop fishing, Before, he was a fisherman.  In 2010, Bai established his general stock business.  He works at the business from 8:00am until 6:00pm, Monday to Friday. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and sometimes purchasing power is slow.

Bai requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, soft drinks, and milk. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and buy a piece of land. In the future.  Bai plans to own the biggest shop in the community. Bai thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, soft drinks, and milk.

loans.name: Alhaji                  Yusufu

texts.en:
This is Alhaji Yusufu from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. He is in his late fifties. He is married and has seven children between the ages of 14 and 37 years. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support himself and his wife, instead of waiting for his children to support him. 

Alhaji Yusufu runs a general store.  He sells drinks, cigarettes, ketchup and tooth paste. He has been running this business 20 years. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Alhaji Yusufu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, and ketchup and tooth paste. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and have his daily meal. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarette, and ketchup and tooth paste.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Doña Aida tiene 42 años de edad es madre de una hijo, ama de casa y agricultora, casada con un grado de educación primaria completa. Como madre de familia, mujer emprendedora y trabajadora vela por el bienestar de su familia y decidió hace un tiempo el cual es la venta de caña de azúcar y la venta de café que lo practica hace 25 años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Su esposo es agricultor también y en su compañía son los únicos que se involucran en el cultivo de café. La tierra que trabajan es propia la cual es adquirida por herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicada alrededor de su casa de habitación por lo cual le permite estar más al pendiente de sus cultivos.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera entre otros que aran de sus cultivos más atractivos y confiables para el intermediario-comprador final. 

Actualmente su meta es proteger sus cultivos asistirlos de manera especial y fortalecerlos de manera que al final de la cosecha ella pueda sacar las ganancias esperadas y poder obtener ingresos para cumplir con su compromiso.
texts.en:
Aida, 42, is married and has a son.  She received a full elementary education and is both a homemaker and farmer.  As an enterprising, hard-working woman she looks out for her family's well-being.  Some time ago she decided to sell sugar cane and coffee, and has been in business for 25 years.  Her parents taught her how to farm the land when she was very young.  Her husband is a farmer, too, and they are the only ones who are involved in the coffee growing.  They own the land that they inherited from their parents, which is next to the house where they live, allowing them to be able to look after their crops easier.

Aida has requested a loan through COMIXMUL to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, leaf treatment, coffee crop formula and other items to make her crops more attractive and trust-worthy for the final dealer-buyer.

Her current goal is to protect her crop and give it special care so as to strengthen it for the final harvest.  This is to earn a good profit and make enough income to fulfill her repayment commitment.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is married with two children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Currently, Celestina sells shito (a pepper sauce) in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. 

Her husband is a second hand clothes dealer. Celestina's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Celestina will use the loan to increase her existing shito capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise,  Celestina plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing shito (black pepper sauce) capacity.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is married to a construction worker.  She has five children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day.  As a primary school graduate,  Mary currently sells palm oil in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over nine years of experience in this trade,   Mary sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more palm oil ,indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.  Mary wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: buy more palm oil

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo  is glad to be connected with supporters of BRAC Liberia. She commented that this is her third time taking loan from BRAC Liberia,  which has been a great help for her and her children. She said that with these loans she has been able to continue her education  in a university, and she boasts of her children's school fees being paid on time during the past semesters. 

Korpo is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville; she’s married with three children aged 9 to 15 who are attending school and  live at home. Over the past five years she have been selling charcoal, etc. Korpo has requested this third loan to purchase more charcoal to increase her sales even more.

 She points out low inventory as her challenge in her business. She started this business by helping her mother with a table business, and later established her own business. So in fact, she learned the business from her mother.  In the near future she would like to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Please meet 44-year-old Janet. She is from Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.  Unfortunately, Janet was not able to attend school. She is married with six children between the ages of four and 23. Three of her children live at home and attend school. Janet describes herself as a hardworking woman.  For the past seven years, she has run a shop where she sells fashionable clothes. She started her business with money from her mother and transports her goods by taxi. Janet works five hours a day seven days a week and her major business challenge is to increase her sales. 

Janet is requesting a loan to buy fashion clothes to sell.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. In the future, Janet plans to educate all her children.  She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy fashion clothes to sell

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.fr:
Claudine fait partie du groupe  Indatwa et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Emmanuel, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés  de 5 à 15 ans, tous  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce du manioc, de la patate douce, du colocase,…  depuis 13 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de manioc, de patate douce, de colocase,…   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation des marchandises du Congo ou de la Tanzanie  et voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
Claudine is a member of the group Indatwa. She lives in Bujumbura. She is married to a tailor named Emmanuel and they have six children aged 5 to 15 years old who all go to school.
