Claudine has been selling cassava, yams, taro, etc. for 13 years. This is her 3rd loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the credit to bolster her working capital and buy many kilos of cassava, yams and taro to sell, thus increasing her revenue. 

In the coming years, she would like to import merchandise from the Congo or Tanzania. She wants her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and buy many kilos of cassava, yams, and taro to sell, thus increasing her revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dough sheeter and oven.

loans.name: Dora Esmeralda

texts.es:
Dora, es una persona trabajadora. Ella, vive con su familia y posee una tienda para adquirir ingresos y asi aportar a su familia. El prestamo que solicita le permitira  fortalecer más su negocio y dicha  inversión le ayudara a comprar variedad de granos básicos, tales como: arroz, frijoles, sal, azúcar, bebidas, entre otros.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ganancias, aumentar la clientela  y asimismo incrementar el inventario; tambien  lograr cambiar las circunstancias familiares para brindarle una mejora calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a hard-working person who lives with her family.  She owns a store to earn income she contributes to the family.  The loan she is requesting is to strengthen her business and allow her to buy a variety of staples such as rice, beans, salt, sugar, drinks, etc.

Her goal is to increase her inventory and clientele in order to improve her profits.  She hopes to change the household circumstances to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Harm              Deen

texts.en:
This is Harm from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. He is 40 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 18 years. Two of his children are going to school. He began this business because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family.

Harm runs a general store business.  He sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap, etc. He has been running this business since after the rebel war. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenge to his business is the high rate of theft within the community.

Harm has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, Pure Water and mayonnaise. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and buy a plot of land. In the future, he plans to become a agent of provision and cigarette seller. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, Pure Water and mayonnaise

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet Abdul. He is in his late 40s and is from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. Abdul is married with two children ages eight and 13. For the past ten years, he has run a local food business.  Abdul began his business because his parents did not send him to school and so he learned business. He works seven days a week from eight in the morning through seven at night. Abdul's main business challenges are storage facilities and the high cost of transportation.

Abdul is requesting a loan to purchase more beans, gari (cassava flour) and bags of ground nuts to sell. He hopes that the extra income from his loan will allow him to empower himself and increase his business. In the future, Abdul plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, gari, and bags of ground nuts to sell

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Sheriff from Waterloo, Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with two children who are 1 and 4. In 2009, Sheriff established his clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to create his own permanent source of income. Before then, Sheriff was a shopkeeper. He works seven days a week from eight in the morning through seven at night. Sheriff's main business challenge is the lack of enough capital.

Sheriff is requesting a loan to buy male and female jeans, shirts, and blouses to resell. He hopes that the extra income from his loan will allow him to increase his business and renovate his house. In the future, Sheriff plans to import goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy male and female jeans, shirts, and blouses

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown, He is in his late forties. He is married with two children, ages 14 years and 19 years. He began this business because he lost his parent and he could not go to school, so this business is his profession.  

Ibrahim runs a general store; he sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. He has been running this business for over 20 years. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and cost of transportation.

Ibrahim has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and bag milk to expand his business. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and change his family's status of living. 

In the future, he plans to own a permanent business location. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and bag milk to expand his business.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Alhassan from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years.  In 2001, Alhassan established his general stock business. He began his business because wanted to create a source of income to take care of his family welfare. He works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business is price inflation and that transporting his goods from his operation area to his business place is very difficult.

Alhassan requires a loan in order to purchase more shoes, bags and suitcases for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to empower his children and increase his business. In the future, Alhassan plans to expand his business to a wholesaler. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, bags and suitcases for resale.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Alimamy from Waterloo, western rural area in Freetown. He is married and has one child, aged two years.  In 2008, Alimamy established his clothing business. He began his business because, after he completed his sixth form, his family could not afford to pay his collage fees.  So he raised money to start up his business.  Before that, he was an office messenger. He works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run the business.

Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans and ladies 'jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future; Alimamy plans to build his own business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans and ladies' jeans

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Betty from Kandeh town Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with six children between the ages of 15 years and 30 years. Two of her children are going to school.

Betty runs a gari business; she sells gari at her house. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Betty has requested a loan in order to purchase more bags of gari to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. 

In the future, Betty plans to further expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Seray from Torkpoi town in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 3 years and 16 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Seray established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.  

Seray requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Seray plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 48 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene tres hijos; pero solo un hijos de 20 años de edad, su nuera y su nieto de aproximadamente un año vienen con ella. Es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo quien depende de las actividades que  ella realiza.

Ella,  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 km  y trabaja junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo durante la mañana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca  y  producir leche; la cual venderá y obtendrá ingresos para el sustento de su familia

 planea comprar mas vacas lecheras para producir leche y poder elaborar lácteos como queso, crema y quesillo y así en un futuro poder construir una casa digna de ladrillo para su familia ya que actualmente es de adobe
texts.en:
Nery, 48, is married and has three children.  The only one living with her, though, is her 20-year-old son, his wife and their one-year-old son.  Nery has a ninth grade education and her husband is a farmer.  She gets up at 5:00 a.m. and helps her husband on the farm.

Nery learned farming from her parents, and she walks a kilometer to the land where she, her husband and her son work in the morning.

The loan she is requesting through the Campo Foundation is to buy a cow to produce milk which she will sell to earn more income for the household.  She plans to buy more dairy cows to make dairy products such as cheese, cream and curd.  Her goal is to build a brick house for her family since the one they live in is made of adobe.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Abner Hiran

texts.es: Abner, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, tiene una hija y vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Abner tiene 17 años de tener su propio negocio de Soldadura y electricidad, fabrica portones de hierro, puertas, balcones para ventanas, toda estructura de metal. El taller lo tiene en su casa y su clientela es de la misma comunidad. Ha invertido varios préstamos en su negocio, actualmente esta solicitando el sexto préstamo que es por 8,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar electrodos, varillas, punturas, lijas y otros que necesita en su taller. Su objetivo es mejorar los ingresos para darle el estudio a su hija y llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Abner, 42, is married and has a daughter.  He lives in a town in the municipality of Arizona, in the department of Atlantida.  Abner has had his own soldering and electrical business for 17 years.  He makes iron gates, doors, and balconies for windows, all out of metal.  He has his workshop in his house, and his customers are from the same community.  He has invested a number of loans in his business.  At this time, he is requesting his 6th loan (for 8,000 Honduran lempiras) to buy electrodes, iron rods, paints, sandpaper, and other supplies he needs for his workshop.  His goal is to increase his income so that he can provide his daughter with an education and become a homeowner.

loans.use: to buy electrodes, iron rods, paints, sandpaper, and other supplies he needs for his workshop

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila sells women's clothes -- skirts, knits, slacks and suits -- from a rented store space. She used her previous KIVA loan to expand her inventory and was able to increase her sales and make additional profit for her family.

This time, Ludmila is requesting a 24,000 UAH loan to increase the assortment of her fall inventories. She will purchase skirts, sweaters, and light coats in bulk at good prices now. Her loan will give Ludmila the opportunity to earn additional income and take better care of her three children. She is a widow and does the best she can to provide her children with everything they need, especially a good education.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her fall inventory

loans.name: Sophiah

texts.en:
Sophiah is a small-scale petty trader who sells vegetables and food items in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Sophiah has been working as a vendor selling vegetables and food items for close to four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables and food items, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a vegetable and food items stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables and food items, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Jesus Te Ama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JESUS TE AMA” iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de carne, venta de accesorios de autos, venta de verduras, costura de camperas, costura de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió a muy corta edad, observando la necesidad que tenían los vecinos de su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The group Jesus Loves You will begin the 20th cycle in Pro Woman as a part of the German Busch Focal Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by the board where Francisca is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association bring are varied among them. There are businesses for sewing coats, selling meat, selling auto accessories, selling vegetables, sewing jackets, sewing sporting goods, and the sale of food.

The loan that they take out will benefit small micro businesses where Francisca is a member. She has been a member of Pro Woman for 3 years, joining by invitation of a friend that is a member of the institution. Today she has a neighborhood store. She undertook this business at a very young age, observing the need of her neighbors in the area.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase the capital (purchase of beer) that she will acquire from the distribution companies in bulk and later sell it in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, as she is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes saving.

loans.use: to purchase beer.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene un  hijo,  convive con su esposa e hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Mario     se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de chanchos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio y al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  

Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Mario, 38, lives with his wife and son in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  The members of the communal bank "Avanza" are farmers who live in the community of Aguas Frías, where they were practically born and raised.  Most of them are in agriculture or work in livestock farming.

Mario grows corn and raises pigs.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and supplies.  The loan will allow him to pay for the fertilizer in cash which will make it less expensive.  Every week he goes to Ventanas to make his purchases.  

His goal is to have his own business.  Competition is his main challenge.  In his free time he enjoys spending time with family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Diogenes Vicente

texts.es:
Diógenes tiene 32 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos hijos,  convive con su esposa e hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Diógenes    se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y  cría de chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y a menor precio.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. 

Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Diógenesis is 32 years old,  He is in a common-law relationship and has two children. He lives with his wife and one of his children in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He is a member of the "VRC Avanza" communal bank. It's members were raised and live in the Aguas Frias area.  Most of them are farmers or raise livestock. 

Diógenes is a farmer. He grows corn and raises pigs. He is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure. With the help of this loan he can buy the fertilizer in cash and at a low price. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each week. His dream is to have his own business. His challenge is his competition. In his spare time he likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios  y obtener mayores ingresos;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: José sees the need for another loan to provide capital for his business. He will use the loan to buy corn, rice, beans, sugar, soap, and more. He increased inventory and his income with the previous loan. His finances and his family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, sugar, soap, and more.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old father of 3 children from Gaza. He took a loan to buy his partner's share of a taxi.

Mahmoud started his business with his brother to buy a taxi, and he found out it's not enough income for both of them so he decided to buy his brother's share.

His future goal is get a newer and bigger taxi to increase the family's income. His biggest challenge is the gasoline prices as Gaza suffers from a 5 year siege.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Saúl Ubaldo

texts.es:
Saúl tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a sembrar maíz y fríjol; actividad que la aprendió de sus padres, desde que era un niño. Antes de dedicarse a la agricultura, él solo trabajaba en el cuido del ganado y como capataz en una hacienda de la comunidad. Saúl, compraba y vendía ganado; pero decidió trabajar solamente en la agricultura. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas; para la siembra de maíz y fríjol, los adquiera en una comunidad que esta a 12 kilómetros de distancia de su vivienda, los cuales recorre en un vehiculo del transporte colectivo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar, semilla, abono, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra y maquinaria para rastrear el terreno y sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados más, debido a que actualmente ya cultivo 7,000 metros cuadrados pero eso no le es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades.

Con la inversión, asegurara la alimentación de su familia, posiblemente hasta el otro año. Dispondrá de maíz y fríjol para su consumo familiar y la otra parte para venderlo en la comunidad. Su sueño es, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia e instalar un negocio de venta de granos básicos en el municipio en donde vive.
texts.en:
Saúl, 45, is married and has three children. For 25 years, he has grown corn and beans, a trade he learned as a child from his parents. Before he started farming, he raised livestock and was the foreman at a local ranch. Saúl bought and sold livestock, but then he decided to dedicate himself to farming. He buys his agricultural supplies for planting corn and beans in a town about 12 kilometers from his house. He makes the trip by bus.

He has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy seed, manure, and weed killer and to pay for labor and equipment to plant an additional 7000 meters of land. He currently works 7000 meters, but that is not enough to meet his needs. He is certain the investment will provide food for his family, possibly until next year. Part of the corn and bean harvest feeds his family; the other part is sold to other residents. He dreams of improving his family's standard of living and of setting up a business to sell basic grains in his town.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and weed killer and to pay for labor and equipment to plant an additional 7000 meters of land.

loans.name: Joan Rose

texts.en:
Joan Rose is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City. For the past few years, Joan Rose has raised pigs to earn a living while her husband has worked as a laborer in the neighborhood. She earns 13,000 PHP each month. Joan Rose has been a member of Gata Daku MPC and is very proud of it because it helps her to improve their quality of life and be an entrepreneur farmer.

Joan Rose is requesting a 12,500 PHP loan to purchase feed for breeding livestock. In the future, she wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase feed for breeding livestock.

loans.name: Alexis Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián tiene  24 años de edad, es soltero, convive con su hermano  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Fabián    se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  

Su sueño es tener  su propio terreno. Su desafío es tener un negocio.  En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar índor.
texts.en:
Fabián is 24 years old, single, and lives with his brother in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "VRC Avanza". Its members work in agriculture and all live in the area of Recinto Aguas Frías. Almost all of them have grown up in that area, and the majority work in agriculture or livestock grazing.

Fabián works in agriculture and grows corn. He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, agricultural supplies, and manures. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each week. His dream is to have his own land. His challenge is having a business. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, agricultural supplies and manures.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 48 years old and married with four children between ages of nine and 16. Her husband is a driver. Cecelia lives and works in Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

For the past 15 years, Cecelia has been running a restaurant where she prepares and sells rice, fufu, and soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients such as dried meat, fish, fufu, pepper, onion, rice, coal, and other staples for her business. Cecelia likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house.  
Cecelia wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients such as dried meat, fish, fufu, pepper, onion, rice, coal, and other staples

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Martha from Kandeh town. She is married with five children between the ages of seven and 22. Four of her children are attending school. For the past eight years, Martha has been running a cement business and selling cement at her house. She works throughout the week. Martha's major business challenge is problems with transportation.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more construction supplies such as cement to resell. The extra income from her loan will allow her to change her family's standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Martha hopes to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies like cement

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Eleanor from Kandeh town in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of two and 10. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Eleanor established her wood business. She began her business because she needed to create a source of income to support her home. Eleanor works 10 hours per day and seven days per week.  She says that her business is doing well because she is able to use her profit to have her daily meal.  

Eleanor is requesting a loan to purchase wood to resell. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Eleanor plans to open a grocery shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta es una mujer que tiene  35 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan y sus 03 hijos a quienes trata de brindarle una buena calidad de vida. Considerada como muy trabajadora por sus vecinos  trata siempre de buscar junto a su esposo la manera de mantener una buena estabilidad económica para su familia.Alberta se dedica a la agricultura. Cuando fue joven se comprometió con Juan y empezó a trabajar junto a el en unos terrenos que sus padres le heredaron cultivando cacao orgánico ya que el terreno que conforman sus cultivos poseen buenos nutrientes que permiten obtener una buena calidad de granos cacaoteros. Al inicio contó con todo el apoyo de sus padres quienes le prestaban dinero para el pago a jornaleros y otros gastos que genera dicha producción logrando salir delante de a pocos. Uno de sus principales inconveniente es transportar sus pesados sacos con sus productos listos para venderse ya que sus terrenos están ubicadas en zonas remotas de la selva donde solo es posible acceder por una vía muy angosta que obliga a los transportistas elevar el precio por sus servicios. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y asi llenar de nutrientes a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alberta, 35, lives in her own house with her husband Juan and her three children, whom she tries to give a good quality of life.  Considered very hardworking by her neighbors, she and her husband always try to find a way to have good economic stability for their family.

Alberta earns a living in agriculture.  When she was young she got engaged to Juan and began to work with him on some land his parents gave to him.  They grew organic cacao because their land has good nutrients that allow a good quality cacao bean.  In the beginning she had the complete support of her parents, who loaned her money to pay the day laborers and for other production expenses, and gradually they managed to get ahead.

One of her main problems is transporting the heavy sacks with her products ready to sell.  Her land is located in a remote area of the wilderness that's only accessible by a very narrow road, which causes the shippers to raise the price for their services.

This is her second Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead and she promises to make her payments punctually.

Currently she wants to have 3,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Aydee se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo en un terreno de cultivo de una hectárea y media que le vendió un familiar suyo a un precio cómodo. Aydee se encarga de mantener en buen estado las plantaciones de cacao de posee ya que debe optimizar su producción, es por ello que contrata a trabajadores del lugar y junto a su esposo retiran periódicamente la maleza que crece para evitar que consuman los nutrientes naturales de sus terrenos, además fertiliza sus suelos con abono orgánico para así obtener un mejor resultado.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que lo desempeña desde niña y esto le permite estar junto a su esposo.
Comenta que uno de sus objetivos es poner una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles en su hogar para obtener ganancias adicionales en las tardes. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aydee, 30, is married and has two children who live with her in her adobe house. Aydee and her husband farm a one-and-a-half hectare plot that they bought from a relative at a good price. Aydee makes sure their cacao plants are in good condition so that they optimize production. She wants to hire local workers to work with her husband to regularly clear the weeds that consume the soil's natural nutrients. She also wants to apply organic fertilizer to the soil to improve her harvest. She likes her work, which she has done since childhood, because she can work alongside her husband. 

One of her goals is to open a small food shop in her house to earn additional income in the afternoons. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to go forward. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucilia

texts.en:
Lucilia is 48 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.  

Lucilia has five children between the ages of 12 and 29. Only two of her children are in school and living at home. Lucilia's parents did not send her to school, and she been selling pepper, oil, rice, salt, and other items for the past 10 years in the local market. She likes her business because it helps to support her home.

Lucilia is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a shop and educates all her children. Lucilia wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Zeniel

texts.en:
Zeniel is a 21-year-old, married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has two young children. 

Zeniel goes fishing. He sells fish to earn for a living. He earns PHP 6,500 a month by selling fish. He has been selling fish for more than two years.

To sustain his livelihood activity, Zeniel requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, and food for the family. 

In the future, Zeniel hopes that he could improve his fishing business and be able to pay his weekly dues.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for his business.

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es: Olga con 33 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos de 14 y 11 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 13 años administra un un negocio, que su suegro le dejó de herencia, un café bar donde ofrece gaseosas, cervezas, café, mecato, entre otros productos. El negocio tiene 50 años de existencia, por lo que ya es reconocido en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado. Olga aprendió la actividad de manera empírica y con el apoyo de su esposo y un empleado han podido mantenerlo; pero debido a dificultades económicas no han podido invertirle dinero para hacerlo crecer, pues por ahora sólo es posible generar ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la ampliación y arreglo del negocio y comprar surtido (gaseosas, café, cervezas, mecato), con lo cual podrá darle una mejor imagen al negocio que cambie la percepción de los clientes y además tendrá variedad de productos para ofrecer, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de las ventas y por ende, de sus ingresos. Además podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es hacer crecer su negocio, tenerlo bien surtido y en un corto plazo poder implementar algunos billares para incrementar la afluencia de clientes, con lo que podrá mejorar la estabilidad económica, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar de unas mejores condiciones de vida al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old, the mother of two children, 11 and 14 years old. She lives with her common law partner. For the past 13 years she has run a business, that her father-in-law left her as an inheritance, a bar that offers soft drinks, beer, coffee, pastries and other products. The business has been in existence for 50 years, so it is well known in the area it is located in. 

Olga learned this business by working in it and with the help of her husband and an employee has been able to maintain it. But due to financial difficulties she has not been able to invest money to make the business grow, since up to now she has only made enough to support her household. So she is requesting this loan to expand and fix-up the business and to buy stock (soft drinks, coffee, beer, pastries). Doing this she can improve the image of the business which will change the customers perception of it. She will also have a variety of products to offer, which will be reflected by higher sales and in the end, greater profits. 

She can also advance towards the accomplishment of her main goal, which is to expand her business, stock it well, and in the short term install a few billiard tables to increase the influx of clients. With which she can enjoy more economic stability, provide better education for her children and enjoy a higher standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to expand and fix up her business and buy stock (soft drinks, coffee, beer, pastries)

loans.name: Mark Donnel

texts.en:
Mark Donnel is married, 32 years old, and lives with his wife in Lapasan, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Mark Donnel is operating a service-based business, providing motor rental and transportation services in the local community to earn a living while his wife works in a private company. He has been doing this for four years. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 in order to acquire another unit of motor transport for business expansion.

Since 2009, Mark Donnel has been a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). In the future, he hopes to have his own house and lot and to improve his business for his family.

loans.use: to acquire another unit of motor transport for his business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 61 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. 

To make a living, her husband works as a farmer on their own farm while Angelina owns and operates a retail store. She has been in this line of work for  years and earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

In 2008, Angelina joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and is now applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell, like canned goods and feed. She hopes to earn additional profits from her the business, so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods and feed.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro  tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, convive con su madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Pedro   se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y a menor precio.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  

Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasear
texts.en:
Pedro, 24, is single and lives with his mother in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He belongs to the communal bank Avanza, whose members are farmers who live in Aguas Frías. Pedro grew up in this neighborhood, where most of the residents are farmers or fishermen. Pedro plants corn and raises chickens. 

He has applied for a loan to buy wholesale fertilizer, supplies, and manure at lower prices. He makes his purchase in Ventanas weekly. He dreams of having his own business, and competition is his main challenge. He likes to walk in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manure.

loans.name: Yoconda Karina

texts.es:
Yoconda tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo, convive con su madre e  hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Yoconda  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, cacao y cría de pollos y chanchos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y a menor precio.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. 

Su desafío es la competencia. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en su casa.
texts.en:
Yoconda is 22 years old, single, and with a child. She lives with her mother and child in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The name of the communal bank is VRC Avanza. Its members make a living through agriculture. They all live in the sector of the precinct of Aguas Frías. They have practically grown up in that zone. They make a living through agricultural work or wholesale livestock.

Yoconda works in agriculture. She sows corn and cacao, and raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manure. With the support of the loan she will be able to buy fertilizers with cash and at a reduced price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manure.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los ángeles es originaria de la ciudad Estelí, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo. Es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada quien con mucho sacrificio, esfuerzo y estudio ha sacado adelante junto al apoyo de su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos y zapatos. ya que tiene demanda en sus productos, el  financiamiento será de mucha ayuda ya que tendrá variedad en su tienda y podrá satisfacer necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio con el fin de adquirir mayores ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles was born in Estelí and is 28. She lives with her husband and son. She is a merchant who sells new and used clothing. Through sacrifice, hard work, education, and family support, she has gotten ahead.

She has applied for a loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts, dresses and shoes to meet strong demand. The funding will help her provide greater variety in her store and satisfy her clients' needs. Her goal is to grow her business so that she earns more and enjoys a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Saba Tening's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 27 Juin  2008 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre du groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

Madame Aminata (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 01 fille. Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme et de savon traditionnel qu’elle revend par bouteille d’un litre pour l’huile de palme et par morceau pour le savon respectivement 1 000  et 100 F CFA.

Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter deux bidons d’huile de palme à 16 000 F CFA l’un pour la revente au détail.

Avec les bénéfices, elle pense mieux accompagner son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 27, 2008 when their 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is comprised of women who all live in the same village. They share values of solidarity and mutual assistance that characterize their actions and relationships between group members, whose main work involves small-scale commerce and also rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Aminata (seated at the far right in the photo with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of six children, including one daughter. She sells palm oil and traditional soap that she resells by the 1-liter bottle for the palm oil and by the piece for the soap, respectively at 1,000 francs and 100 francs CFA. 

With this loan, she is going to purchase two containers of palm oil at 16,000 francs each, so as to sell the oil retail.

With the profits, she is think of helping her husband to manage family expenses better.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, medicines, and food for the family and to pay laborer fees

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from Bliss Baybay, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old, married, and has five adult children. Her husband is a stall vendor in the city while Luzminda owns and operates a general store at home, selling a variety of different products in their community. She has been in her business for years and the earnings have been great. Luzminda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed, rice and corn grits to sell.
She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for many years. Luzminda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo is from Panta-on Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and married with two children. Arturo is a farmer who manages a gardening business to earn a living. Aside from farming, he was engaged in motor rental and transportation services to earn an extra income. His neighbour rented his motor especially when he had to work in his farm. He has had this work for more than 4 years. Arturo has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Arturo has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. He planned to cultivate the adjacent land area to generate more harvest to be used for the future needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 53-year-old widow and resides in Liposong, Ozamis City with her married children. She provides her four children's needs from the little amount she earns from her own piggery business. She has had the business for more than five years as an aid to the income gained. She also manages a farm of corn and bananas - it is the main source of income. In 2007 she became a member of Gata Daku MPC and it helped her to become an educated farmer in their community. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Nena wants to expand her piggery and to be able to earn more income to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Marleni Ubelda

texts.es:
Marleni, es una mujer de 32 años, vive con su familia que la componen su padre un anciano de 56 años, dos hermanos de 35 y 19 años y con su hija una menor de 9 años de edad, ella es el único sustento de su familia ya que todos ellos dependen económicamente de ella.
Marleni, posee una tienda y una venta de pupusas, tiene un año de tener el negocio y trabaja a tiempo completo, ella solicita el crédito para realizar compra de: frijoles, arroz, carne de res y pollo, además mercadería para la tienda y de esa manera incrementar el negocio y a la vez sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida para su grupo familiar.
Ella tiene muchos sueños por cumplir y es por eso que  se esfuerza para un día poder realizarlos, como lo son: tener un negocio más grande y diversificado en venta de comida, tienda y venta de ropa, darle estudio a su hija y que en el futuro sea profesional y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Marleni, 32, lives with her family, which comprises her 56-year-old father; two brothers, ages 35 and 19; and her nine-year-old sister. She is the sole provider for the family, and everyone is financially dependent on her.

Marleni has operated her store and sold pupusas for a year. She works full time. She has applied for a loan to buy beans, rice, meat, chicken, and inventory for the shop so that she can grow her business and income and raise her family's standard of living.

She has many dreams: growing and diversifying her food business and shop; selling clothing; giving her daughter an education to follow a professional career; and owning a house. She works hard each day to achieve these dreams.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, meat, chicken, and inventory for the shop.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es una mujer ya mayor de edad y vive con una hija y una nuera, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, venta de leña y productos de belleza; actividad que la desarrolla desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. o dependiendo como este la demanda, este oficio lo empezó por necesidad el cual hasta el día de hoy ya tiene 15 años de ejercerlo.  
Ella nos solicita el crédito para realizar compra de leña, sacos de maíz, lociones y cosméticos y de esa manera poder agrandar el negocio y obtener mayores ganancias y poder pagar deudas y realizar algunos gastos del hogar.
Teresa, sueña con ver crecer su negocio y poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Teresa is an older woman who lives with a daughter and daughter-in-law.  She sells tortillas, firewood and beauty products.  She works from 8am to 3pm, depending on the demand.  She began this business out of necessity, but to this day she has run it for 15 years.  

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase firewood, bags of corn, lotions and cosmetics, which will allow her to expand her business and increase her revenues in order to pay her debts and afford some of her household expenses.  Teresa dreams of seeing her business grow and owning her own home.

loans.use: purchase firewood, bags of corn, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Khady Thiouth's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 25 juin 2002. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main Aminata est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage de faire du commerce. Elle va vendre divers produits de la mer, des légumes, de l'huile de palme. Pour se ravitailler, elle se rend dans la zone où elle peut avoir la marchandise est à bon prix. Elle va acheter 50 kgs de poissons séchés à 700f le kg pour revendre à 1200f. 2 paniers de poissons fumés à 300f le kg et revendre à 800f, 2 bidons de 20 litres d'huile de palm.
 Les bénéfices lui serviront à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of seven women is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on created on June 25, 2002. The group brings together women who live in and around the same village. They keep up good relationships, and they work in commerce and in livestock farming.   

Standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, Aminata is 44 years old, married, and the mother of six. With this loan, she envisions working in commerce She is going to sell a variety of seafood products, vegetables, and palm oil. To stock up, she travels around the area where she can obtain merchandise at good prices. She is going to  purchase 50 kg of dried fish at 700 francs per kilo to be resold at 1,200 francs; 2 baskets of smoked fish at 300 francs per kilo to be resold at 800 francs; and two 20-liter containers of palm oil. The profits will be used to pay her children's school fees and to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase smoked and dried fish and some palm oil

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stocks of snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries, to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Gloria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 46 years old and is married with 6 children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ofelia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Ofelia has been pig fattening for 6 years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling coconuts. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.
Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.
Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 9 years and also earns income from farming and selling vegetables.
Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cira Angelina

texts.es:
Cira tiene 25 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene un hijo, convive con su esposo e hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Cira se dedica a vender productos yambal y ropa por catalogo. 

Solicita el crédito para  comprar pantalones,blusas. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  adquirir mercaderia a menor precio.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. 

Su desafío es la competencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en su casa.
texts.en:
Cira is 25 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and she has a child. They all live in the town of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. 

The members of the Avanza communal bank are farmers and they all live in the Aguas Frias community, where most of them grew up. The majority of them are farmers or raise livestock. 

Cira sells Yanbal brand products and clothes through a catalog. She is requesting this loan to buy pants and blouses. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase the merchandise at a lower price. She will buy the merchandise in Ventanas every week. 

Cira dreams of having her own business. Her challenge is the competition. She likes to spend her free time at home.

loans.use: to buy pants and blouses.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El joven Henry, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua llamado Hialeah, padre que se preocupa por el bienestar y la educación de sus hijas. Junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa busca como salir adelante y crear mejores condiciones dentro de su hogar para el bienestar de la familia. Henry se dedica a su labor como electricista. Solicita el crédito porque necesita comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra y levantamiento de un cuarto, esta mejora le permitirá gozar de bienestar en el hogar y un poco más de espacio y privacidad para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The young Henry is a resident of a neighborhood peripheral to Managua named Hialeah. He is a father who is concerned with the well-being and the education of his daughters. Along with his wife, who is a homemaker, they are looking to come out ahead and create better conditions in their home for the well-being of their family.

Henry makes a living through his work as an electrician. He is requesting the loan because he needs to buy construction materials to begin the construction and raising of a room. This improvement will allow him to enjoy well-being in his home and a have a little more space and privacy for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and gravel.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.
She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Merlyn is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.
Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her goal of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a diligent maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to expand his farming operation to farm 10 hectares of land and improve his standard of living.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, so that his family can eat healthier maize and he can get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double their yield and incomes

loans.name: Abahirwe Group

texts.fr:
Charlotte fait partie du groupe  Abahirwe et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est marié à Aloys, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 13 à 27 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de pomme de terre, de banane,...  depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de pomme de terre, de banane,…  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait faire le commerce d’importation des marchandises de Kampala, et avoir  son propre logement.
texts.en:
Charlotte is part of the group Abahirwe and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Aloys, a civil servant. Together they have three children, from 13 to 27 years old, all students.

Charlotte has been doing commerce in potatoes, bananas, …  for eight years. 

She is on her 16th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilograms of potatoes, bananas,… to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to do business importing merchandise from Kampala and to have her own housing.

loans.use: To purchase many kilograms of potatoes, bananas, .. to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a small-scale, petty trader who sells foodstuff and provisions in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education since she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver.  

Dorcas has been working as a petty trader for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions and other foodstuff, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of expanding her provision store, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions and other foodstuff, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room with a bathroom

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives in the village of Tsaghkunk in the Gegharkunik Region. He lives with his parents and sister, none of whom is employed except Hayk, who is the breadwinner in his family. Hayk is a very skilled tractor driver, and, using his father’s tractor, Hayk is very often hired by other villagers to do some work in their fields. Besides this, Hayk also is engaged in farming, and his family members are engaged in it as well. They have a plot of land on which they mainly cultivate potato and grain. They have two cows, one heifer, nine bulls, a calf, five sheep, and three lambs on their farm. They sell all their farm products - potatoes, grain, milk, cheese, and meat - through resellers.

Hayk is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy tractor tires and some spare parts for the tractor.

loans.use: to buy tractor tires and some spare parts for the tractor

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira and her nice family live in a beautiful and sunny city, Yerevan. Elmira is married, and she has a daughter and a son. Her son is a student at Yerevan State Theatrical Institute, and, in the near future, he will become a theatre actor. Her daughter lives in Russia. Elmira’s husband works as a taxi driver. Elmira has a higher education as a pedagogue. She works at a school as a mathematics teacher for elementary classes, and she loves her work very much. As she mentions, work with children is very interesting and tense, but, at the same time, she teaches the lessons very skillfully, full of games and interactive methods, which are very useful for that age of pupils. Elmira also teaches paid courses of mathematics at home with several children.

Elmira has decided to request a loan of 650,000 AMD, as she wants to buy a computer and some literature connected with her specialty, which will be very useful both for her courses and her home.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature connected with her specialty

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Rebecca  decided to set up her own provision business in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over three years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. This loan will be used to help her purchase more provisions for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a contractor) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 32-year-old maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  He hopes to improve his standard of living.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double their yield and incomes

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en:
La’azarus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  As many fathers, he hopes for a better life ahead which allows him to send his children to the best schools and improve his way of living.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to increase his yields and has noticed a great change in his farm compared to the past.  

Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to expand his farming operation to farm 10 hectares of land.  With his loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Haniceta

texts.en:
Haniceta is 52 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns and operates a business raising pigs to sell in the local community to earn a living. She also helps her husband plant and harvest a variety of crops on their farm as their main source of income. She has been doing this for many years .

She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she borrowed money to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farm.

Editha has been in this business for six years. Editha earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting another loan to further build her farming and fishing businesses.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en: Rosetta, 31 years old, lives in the West Point area which has the busiest market in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children. She was unfortunate to have to end her education in the 8th grade. For the past year, she has been operating a shop which sells charcoal in the local market. She spends 10 hours a day at her business. She like her business because she has many customers and makes lots of profit. She started this business with money given to her by husband. Most of the time, she uses the bus to transport her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build her own house and become an international businesswoman. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 35 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has three children, ages 14 to 18, who live with her and go to school. She stopped her education at grade six. Over the past seven years, she has been running a table business selling vita, pepper, onion salt, oil, bitter ball, etc. in the Waterside market. She started with her own money and learned how to sell high-priced food ingredients in Monrovia. Evelyn has requested a loan to purchase more vita, pepper, onion salt, oil, bitter ball, etc. to attract more customers. In the future, she wanys to build her house and increase her business. She is glad to be a BRAC borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, pepper, onion salt, oil, bitter ball etc. to attract more customers.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila cultivates maize on her piece of land.  As a devoted mother, she tends to her farm diligently although inaccessibility to quality inputs made her yield very low, thus making it difficult to meet her children's needs.  Now, she is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to increase her yields through improved inputs.  

Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, she hopes to eventually expand her farming operation to farm 15 hectares of land like the rest of her Trust Group members.  With her loan, she is on her way to achieving these dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and allowing her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and incomes

He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to increase his yields through improved inputs. loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fishing equipment like a fishing net for her business.

Julie has been in this business for three years. Julie earns additional income from a general store.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment like a fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Delia is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal for her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Dule Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm, and looks forward to being able to provide his family 3 square meals a day and grow his farming operation to produce a large volume of many different crops.  

Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to send his children to a better school and invest in starting a new business to provide additional income to his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and incomes

loans.name: Barnabas

He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and hopes to get to 10 hectares in the near future.  Like all Babban Gona members, Barnabas has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, Barnabas hopes to continue to invest in his farms and farm commercially.  He also dreams of sending his children to school and ensuring they have the opportunity to be gainfully employed as adults.  With this loan, Barnabas is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with 3.75 bags of high quality fertilizer and 4.75 2kg bags of Aflasafe, which protects the maize from toxins, for his 1-hectare farm.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and incomes

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is married with four children and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City. Marisa and her husband work together with their buy and sell business and general store. She has been in her business for more than 10 years. Being a member of Gata Daka MPC has helped them a lot as entrepreneurs.. Recently, she requester a loan to buy canned goods and sachet products to sell. She hopes to buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and sachet product to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar and canned goods for her general store business.

Ligaya has been in this business for 10 years. Ligaya earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 48, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo and they have three children who are all in school. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
 
Josefina operates a buy and sell business. She sells different products, from coffee to coconuts and candies. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional products like sugar, coffee, plastic, coconut, peanuts and different candies needed in her business.

Josefina dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products like sugar, coffee, plastic, coconut, peanuts and different candies needed in her business.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en: Eli is a devoted mother, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Lumu Village of Kaduna.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to grow her farm and looks forward to her Trust Group having the highest yields in Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, she hopes to bring positive change to her life and her family.  With this loan, she is on her way to achieving these dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and gain access a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and allowing her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Ruya

texts.en: Ruya is a 25-year-old caring mother, maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Lumu Village of Kaduna.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to grow her farm and looks forward to her Trust Group having the highest yields in Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income. Her most recent loan from Babban Gona allowed her to purchase enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and gain access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, so that she and her family can eat healthier maize and she can get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.name: Dinatu

texts.en:
Dinatu is a devoted mother, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Lumu Village of Kaduna.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to grow her farm and looks forward to growing her farm further so she can possibly buy her first car.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  

With this increase in earnings, she hopes to continue be able to use her profits to send her children - Leatu, Yushua, Deborah, Ladi and Hannatu - to school.  Her dream is that they will all become nurses and engineers.  With this loan, she is on her way to achieving these dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and allowed her access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, so that she and her family can eat healthier maize and she can earn a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further so he can move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue to use his profits to send his children to school.   With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.
