His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and allowed him to purchase a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and affording him the opportunity to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married, 55 years of age, and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City, together with her family.

She is operating a general store while her husband is earning money with his hair-cutting services to earn a living. Lourdes has been in her business for  years and she earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

She is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional canned goods as well as bottled and dairy products. After she joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), her access to financial services was open to them and it helps address their needs for business capital. Lourdes hopes that her business will be more progressive.

In the future, Lourdes will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college and also support them with their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods as well as bottled and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling coconut leaves.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fishing net, and other materials to use for fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other materials to use for fishing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married, with three children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from a bakery and raising pigs.

Gloria aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adrian Jesus

texts.es:
Adrian  tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo, convive con su madre en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.


Adrian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, a la cría de pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas cada semana.  Su sueño es tener  su propio negocio. 

Su desafío es la competencia. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Adrian is 22 years of age, is single, and has a son. He lives with his mother in the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Ríos Province. 

A description of the Avanza Community Bank is as follows: Its members are farmers who all live in the Agua Frías community, where most of them grew up; the majority of them are farmers or livestock breeders. 

Adrian is a farmer who cultivates corn and raises chickens. 

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizer at a lower price, because he will be paying cash. He makes purchases in Ventanas every week. 

His dream is to have his own business. His challenge is the competition. 

In his spare time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, manure.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu, a 30-year-old devoted father and maize farmer, is a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further so he can move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue be able to use his profits to send his children to school.   With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and allowed him access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, which enabled his family to eat healthier maize and helped him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en: Munkaila is a 35-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further so he can move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to send his children to school.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and allowed him access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, which enabled his family to eat healthier maize and helped him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Jancent

texts.en:
Jacent is a very young man who really loves to help his family, especially in terms of finances. He is 22 years old and from the village of Divisoria, a mountainous area in Isabela. 

Aside from farming, Jancent is employed as a nursery school teacher in his village. According to him, he really loves to teach children and to further help his parents. 

Farming is his major source of income. Because of this, he is asking for a loan of Php20,000 to buy  fertilizer and seeds to grow in his rice field. One of his dreams someday is to build his own house for his future family.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and seeds to grow in his rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is a 39-year-old, married man and a father of three children. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than eight years now. This is the source of his income.

Benedicto is asking for a loan to buy spare wheel tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle. Benedicto also wants to save money to pay the educational expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare wheel tires, nuts and bolts, and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, with her two children. To make a living, she has been running a cafeteria in their village for more than four years. Her income has helped a lot, to augment their living situation.

Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy raw ingredients and new kitchenware, to be used in her business. She is hoping to generate more income for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and new kitchenware for her cafeteria

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

My name is Gonzala and I am 59 years old. I live in Mexico City in a neighborhood called Itzapalapa and I have one daughter. I sell all kinds of chiles,seeds such as beans, lentils, rice, sugar and other groceries. I have been in my business for 15 years already. 

I will use this loan to purchase goods, to paint my store and the curtain of my store and to give my business a new image. With this credit, I am hoping to increase sales and to make my business more attractive for the general public. My biggest accomplishments are giving my daughter an education, buying my house and having my own business. I consider myself a responsible person because I can manage everything on my own.

loans.use: to purchase dry chiles, seeds, beans and lentils for my business

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Minda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy vegetables to resell, at her greengrocer's stall. In the future, Minda would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She sells fish in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Beverly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Beverly has been sustaining her business through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, snack foods, milk, noodles and other groceries for her general store.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, snack foods, milk, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Richelle Jane

texts.en:
Richelle Jane is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Richelle Jane is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Richelle Jane has been farming rice for three years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, and she earns additional income from prepared food vending, and by farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Annie has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store and from raising ducks.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Macs

texts.en:
Macs, 28 years old, is still single. He lives with his parents in their house made of wood, located in Sta. Maria. Macs has been a farmer for six years. He managed to get his own piece of land, where he produces rice by his own hard work. His long-term goal is to open a store with various food products to sell, for his mother to maintain. This way, he will be able to provide something better for his parents.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000, which he will use to buy organic fertilizers for his rice crop's development. He is grateful for this support, if given the chance, in order to get ahead in life. He pledges to make his payment punctually.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is already 45 years old, married, and lives happily with his family in the village of Divisoria. 

He is into the agriculture sector, particularly as a rice producer. Farming has been his family's main source of income. He hopes to improve their way of living through farming. He dreams for a better business, to give his children their full education. Drought and floods are his major challenges in maintaining his good production, but despite of these, he remains strong and determined in pursuing his farming. 

Roberto is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 and he intends to use the loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anna Jane

texts.en:
Anna Jane is 34 years old and married. She has three children. She works hard to provide for her family, running her general store, in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns additional income by direct-selling Avon products.

She requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like sugar, rice, and other groceries.

Anna Jane has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like sugar, rice, and other groceries.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a married woman and a mother of three children from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than five years now.

Florita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Florita hopes to expand her farming venture so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita is married with five children. She is 51 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City with her family. Her husband worked as an electric cooperative employee to earn a living while she manages their motorcycle rental and transportation services. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and has requestd a loan to buy spare parts and pay for repair costs. She hopes to buy a vehicle in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay for repair costs

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en:
Dalisay is 50 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school. Dalisay works very hard to provide for them, running a business where she sells firewood, in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional firewood to sell. Dalisay would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 39 years old and is married with three children.

Jinky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like rice, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell.

Jinky has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jinky aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like rice, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional products like sugar, rice, bottled water, eggs, milk, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products like sugar, rice, bottled water, eggs, milk, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Farming is the major source of income for families in the peaceful place where Jay lives. He is 31 years old and lives with his family in that place located in Cagayan Valley. He has four children. His wife does the house chores and nurses their children. In her free time, she helps him in their farm cultivation and maintenance. Jay has not achieve any higher education and most years, he worked in his farm. To further improve his production, Jay is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP and will use it to purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds to grow on the farm.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds to grow in his farm.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. To make a living, her husband works as a construction worker while she runs a general store, selling a variety of different products such as sugar, bread, soap, shampoo, noodles, juice packs, and sardines in the local community. She has had her business for some years.

In 2009, Sophia joined GDMPC. Sophia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items like dried fish and rice to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items like dried fish and rice to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Helen runs a "sari-sari" (variety store) business, selling various goods to the people in her area. This is the source of her income.

Helen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as soda and beverages, canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety and quantity of her stock, which will attract more buyers to her store. Helen dreams of expanding her store and making it a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as beverages, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years. She earns additional income from food vending and from selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle, which is used in the transport business. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle, which is used in her transport business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Juliet is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like t-shirts, shorts, sandals, etc. to sell.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like t-shirts, shorts, sandals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles and spices to sell for her general store business. Lani has been in this business for 5 years and earns more income from raising livestock.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and to continue raising livestock. Lani has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products like canned goods, noodles and spices to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business selling herbal medicine, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Lucia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional box of herbal medicine to sell. In the future, Lucia would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Belinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Having repaid her previous loan, Ma. Belinda is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soft drinks, biscuits, soap, etc. to sell.

Ma. Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income by raising pigs. Mercy is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Mercy has sustained her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Sandra Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 28 años de edad,   vive en el Cantón Ventanas,  Provincia Los Ríos, es soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive con sus hijos.

La descripción de la ventanilla es V.R.C Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías. Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.


Amelia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, el crédito va a utilizar para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes al contado y con descuento, las compras lo realiza en Mocache y Ventanas cada semana. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la agricultura y crecer cada día más. 

Su desafío es terminar los estudios. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia is 28 years old and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children.

The members of the community bank V.R.C Avanza all work in agriculture in the district of Aguas Frías.  They have practically been raised in these fields.  The majority of them grow crops or raise livestock.

Amelia is a farmer, and she grows corn.  She will use the loan in order to purchase fertilizer and compost.  With the help of the loan she will be able to purchase these supplies at wholes and obtain a discount.  She makes her purchases in Mocache and Ventanas every week.

Her dream is to continue working in agriculture and grow her business each day.  Her challenge is to finish her studies.  She likes to spend her free time with her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está en unión libre, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una batidora de cemente de un tamaño adecuado y que le facilite su trabajo y así poder aumentar su rendimiento y calidad de sus trabajos y tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de más equipo y otras herramientas, y  también lograr un mejor acabado en las construcciones, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 42 years old and in a civil marriage. He lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. With this loan, he will buy an adequate cement mixer to use at work. This will increase the quality and quantity of his work, to boost his profits so he can continue investing in more equipment and tools. 

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. Luis Ángel has never received any loans from the national banks. FUDECOSUR offers him this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Khairiniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо 48 лет. У нее есть муж, двое сыновей, невестка и внук, с которыми она проживает в селе района Шахритус. Семья Хайринисо занимается земледелием на 0,15 га участке приусадебной земли. Сама Хайринисо выпекает домашние лепешки и продает их на рынке, который расположен рядом с их домом. Хайринисо целеустремленная и усердная женщина. Она хотела бы одновременно начать бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Во дворе их дома уже есть коровник, а также Хайринисо накопила сбережение в размере 1500 TJS. Хайринисо просит кредит для закупа 4-х голов коров и телят и корма. Она планирует выращивать скот в течение 30-35 дней и затем выводить их на скотный рынок для продажи. Кредит поможет Хайринисо иметь дополнительный источник дохода и таким образом улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en:
Khairiniso is 48 years old. She lives with her husband, two sons, a daughter-in-law and a grandson in a village in the Shahrituz region. Khairiniso's family works with field crop cultivation on 0.15 hectares of farm land. Khairiniso bakes homemade cakes and sells them at the market, which is situated next to their home. 

Khairiniso is a purposeful and hard working woman. She would like to start a business of fattening and reselling cattle in addition to the baking. They have a cattle shed in their yard, and Khairiniso has also accumulated savings of 1.500 TJS. 

Khairiniso requests a loan to purchase four cows and calves and fodder. She plans to raise the cattle for a period of 30-35 days and then lead them to the cattle market to sell. The loan will give Khairiniso an additional source of income and this way increase her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four cows and calves and fodder to start a cattle breeding business

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio is asking for a loan of PHP15,000. He plans to use it to buy seeds to grow, and fertilizers for the maintenance of his farm. He plants and harvests rice for a living, in his village. The major challenges in farming are drought, floods and big interest offered by traders/capitalists, which really affect a farmer's income, Dionicio said.

He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He is doing his best to give his children a comfortable living in the future, through farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow, and fertilizers for the maintenance of his farm

loans.name: Reymar

texts.en:
Reymar has been in the farming business for several years. To provide the needed inputs for his crop, he is asking for a loan of PHP15,000. He will use this amount to buy agricultural supplies, like fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides. With the earnings that he obtains from his sales, he manages to cover some of his family's household costs. 

Reymar, who is 21 years old, lives with his wife in their simple village of Divisoria. His dream is to give his family a progressively better means of living. Thus, he is working hard, and he will be thankful for this financial support if it should be approved.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, like fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 44 years of age, is married. She and her husband have been blessed with three children. Agnes has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 18 years. She is earning a net income of PHP 200 per day.

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase groceries to sell at her store, including biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, coffee, and sugar. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be enabled to earn more income and to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell at her store, including biscuits, canned goods and cooking oil

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor, a 47-year-old mother of three, is married to a farmer, and they live in the village of Sampaguita. Leonor, who raises hogs, usually earns about Php 2,000 for each one that she sells, using the profits to pay for her children's school fees and as revolving business capital. 

Now requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs, Leonor would like to keep improving as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es: La señora María  es una mujer  emprendedora, labora  en centro de salud de la zona, donde habita con su familia desde 28 años, desempeñándose como  conserje, es soltera con 1 hijo al  que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, esta señora presenta una necesidad inmediata como es la mejora de su vivienda, por eso se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar  financiamiento y utilizarlo en la compra de cerámica, cemento, bondex, caliche, arena, piedrín y pago  mano de obra , de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María's an enterprising woman.  She works as a caretaker in the health center in the town where she has lived with her family for 28 years.  She's single and has one child.  She gives him the support he needs to develop.

She needs to improve her house immediately, so she's asking CEPRODEL for financing to buy ceramic tiles, cement, sand, and caliche, and to pay for labor.  This way she'll improve her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a hardworking entrepreneur with a general store business in the Philippines that she has been operating for seven years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Nanette is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as noodles, rice, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like noodles, rice, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than three years. This is the source of his income.

Henry is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, for the farm. With these inputs, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm. In the future, Henry hopes to make his farming venture more successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed, with six children in school. She stays in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

For the past 13 years, Margaret has operated a hotel business, preparing a variety of foods and selling them to customers. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.

With the KES 100,000 loan, Margaret wants to renovate her hotel and purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to renovate her hotel and purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to add more stock to her salon, thereby generating more profits. She is now requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase items such as shampoo and hair braids, and to renovate her workplace.

Mwanakombo thanks Yehu for their loan funds that have enabled her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo and hair braids, and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Sozul

texts.ru: Cозул, 47 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). Все дети проживают с матерью. После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи, в поиске доходов для своей семьи, Созул стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством с 1986 года. Бизнес начала с 10 000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Созул достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Созул имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь, 50 овец. Семья очень дружная, все дети помогают матери по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Созул обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку племенного скота. Созул надеется, что получит хороший доход от племенного скота. Доходы от кредита Созул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует купить авто для сына.
texts.en: Sozul is 47 years old, a widow and has four children (2 sons and 2 daughters).  All of the children live with their mother.  After the death of her husband, the family's provider, Sozul became involved in farming and animal husbandry in 1986 in order to find income for her family.  She started the business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard labor and diligent work, Sozul achieved some successes in developing her business and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today Sozul's farm contains three dairy cows, one calf, one horse and fifty sheep.  Her family is very friendly, and all of the children help the mother with the business.  In order to further develop her business, Sozul requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy purebred livestock.  Sozul hopes that she will earn a good income from purebred livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her small business and also plans to buy a car for her son in the future.

loans.use: to buy purebred livestock

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima es una señora, ejemplar,  por vocación eligió la profesión  del  Magisterio, ya que el anhelo más grande,  es relacionarse con los niños.
Esta  señora trabaja en un instituto de la localidad donde vive, desempeñándose como maestra de Educación secundaria con 3 años de ejercer dicha actividad, madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo.

 Actualmente  está  presentando una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y por eso se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un pequeño financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, ladrillo, cemento. Hierro, perlines  y el pago de mano de obra. 

Ya que es la única manera de lograr los sueños de vivir Dignamente con su familia siendo apoyada a través del financiamiento obtenido `por Ceprodel.
texts.en: Fátima is an exemplary woman. She chose a vocation as an educator, since her biggest desire is to work with children. Fátima has worked in a local high school for three years. She is a single mother with one son. At the moment, she is in need of making some improvements on her home. That is why she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel. She will buy zinc, brick, cement, iron, beams, and pay for workers' wages. With the support of this loan, Fátima will be able to achieve her dream of living in a dignified manner with her family.

loans.use: to buy zinc, bricks, cement, iron, beams, and workers' wages.

loans.name: Mshindani

texts.en:
Mshindani, a widowed woman, has five children who are all grown-up and independent. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, Mshindani has operated a beauty salon business. She operates from home whereby neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to accommodate more customers in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics and braids for her business. She decided to join to Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and braids for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a divorced woman, with two children, one of whom is in school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the children.

Grace has operated a clothes-selling business in which she sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by the seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, Grace wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gulayim

texts.ru: Гулайым, 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (3 сына и 1 дочь). В поиске доходов для своей семьи Гулайым с 2005 года стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Гулайым достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулайым имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 18 овец. Также имеет небольшую земельную долю, на которой выращивает: помидоры, огурцы, лук, капусту, картошку- для своего употребления, а также на продажу. Супруг работает в дорожно-эксплуатационном управлении,зарплата у него сдельная. По хозяйству помогают 2 сына. Самый старший сын находится в столице Кыргызстана, работает в Банке, помогает материально, высылая ежемесячно свою зарплату семье. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Гулайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует открыть овощной магазин.
texts.en:
Gulayim is 40 years old, married and has four children (three sons and one daughter). In search of income for her family, Gulayim has been working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding since 2005. She started the business with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and large capacity, Gulayim was able to achieve some progress in developing the business and has reached a monthly income of the amount of 3,000 som (KGS). 

Currently Gulayim has two dairy cows, two bulls and 18 sheep on her farm. She also has a small plot of land, where she grows tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, cabbage and potatoes - for own consumption and for selling. 

Gualyim's husband works with road maintenance management, doing piecework. Two of the sons help with the farm. The eldest son lives in the capital of Kyrgyzstan. He works in a bank and helps the family financially, sending his monthly income to them. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulayim turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow. Gulayim plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her small business, and she also plans to open a small vegetable store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y es separada. En vista de que la carga económica recayó sobre ella luego de terminar la relación con su esposo, decidió buscar la manera de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por lo que tomó cursos de confección y actualmente tiene una pequeño taller en la casa donde vive, allí ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, hace arreglos de modistería y además hace manualidades y bordados, esta actividad la realiza desde hace aproximadamente 10 años y es así como genera ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y para pagar el estudio de sus hijos.  Luz es una mujer trabajadora, pujante y dedicada a sus hijos por quien lucha día a día. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo de un segundo ciclo crediticio para invertirlo en la compra de 3 máquinas (1 fileteadora y 2 planas) con lo que facilitará su labor, mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, podrá incrementar su producción y entregar los pedidos de forma oportuna, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. Esto le ayuda a avanzar, hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia de ropa deportiva, con lo que aumentará su estabilidad económica y tendrá la posibilidad de adquirir una casa propia para brindar mejores condiciones de vida y un mejor bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is the mother of two children and separated.  In light of the financial responsibility that rested on her after she broke up with her husband, she decided to look for a way to generate income on her own.

She took sewing classes and currently has a small workshop in her house where she makes clothing for other people, mends, and also makes crafts and does embroidery.  She has done this work for approximately 10 years and with it she generates income to cover the basic household necessities and pay for her children's studies.

Luz is a hardworking and thriving woman who's dedicated to her children and strives for them every day.

Currently she's requesting the support of a second loan cycle to invest in buying three sewing machines (one serger and two flat machines) to facilitate her work.

She'll improve her working conditions and be able to increase her production and deliver her orders in a timely fashion, which will result in an increase in her income.  This helps her to advance, expand her business, and in the future be able to realize her dream of having her own line of athletic clothing.  Her economic stability will increase and she'll have the possibility of getting her own house and giving her children better living conditions and greater well-being.

loans.use: to buy three sewing machines

loans.name: Zarakhan

texts.ru: Зарахан 54 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей (1 сын и 1 дочь). У Зарахан среднее образование. По характеру трудолюбивая, оптимистично настроена на жизнь. Зарахан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается торговлей мужской и женской одежды, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом KGS. Торговое место в центральном рынке у нее арендованное. Супруг помогает по бизнесу, привозит товар с оптовых рынков, Зарахан реализует свой товар в розницу. Благодаря упорному труду и слаженной работе с супругом Зарахан смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Зарахан расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку мужской и женской одежды для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Зарахан увеличить товарооборот, а также полученная прибыль поможет в  оплате обучения сына в хороших условиях.
texts.en:
Zarakhan is 54 years old, married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). Zarakhan has secondary education. As a person she is hard working, and has an optimistic view on life. 

As a main income for her family, Zarakhan has been working with selling men's and women's clothing since 1995, after having started this business with 3,000 som (KGS). She has a rented retail space at the central market. Her husband helps with the business. He brings goods from wholesale markets, while Zarakhan sells them as retail goods. 

Thanks to Zarakhan and her husband's persistent and coordinated work, they have been able to develop and broaden their assortment of goods. Zarakhan's business brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis to cover the family's food expenses and household needs. The income from the business allowed Zarakhan to increase her turnover. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zarakhan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase men's and women's clothing for reselling. The income from the loan will help Zarakhan increase her turnover and the income received also helps her pay for her son's tuition for education under good conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is widowed and has three children, two are in school and one is an adult. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Emily has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to her town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially when currents run cold in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans at lower cost, to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Raikhan

texts.ru: Райхан 46 лет, разведена, имеет 4 детей (3 сына и 1 дочь). У Райхан высшее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Райхан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2004 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Магазин у нее арендованный, реализует продукты питания. Благодаря упорному труду Райхан, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 40,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Райхан расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 122,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Райхан увеличить товарооборот в продуктовом магазине, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en: Raikhan is 46 years old, divorced and has four children (3 sons and 1 daughter).  Raikhan has a higher education and is well respected by her neighbors.  They say that she is a kind and hardworking woman.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Raikhan has been involved in selling food products since 2004, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS).  She leases her store and sells food products there.  Thanks to her hard work, Raikhan was able to grow her business and expand the merchandise selection.  Her business yields about 40,000 som (KGS) per month, serving as a base for covering family expenses for food and needs.  The income from the business allowed Raikhan to increase her product turnover.  In order to further develop her business, Raikhan requested a loan in the amount of 122,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy food products wholesale for future resale.  The earnings from the loan will help Raikhan to increase product turnover at the food market, and the resulting profit will help her to raise and educate her children in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products wholesale for future resale

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en: Harisu is a 40 year old father, maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further so he can move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to send his children to school.   With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and gain access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a caring father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to when his family members are all so happy to have enough food to eat and be healthy.  In addition, his dream is to continue to grow and expand his farming household.  

Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to send his children Salima and Ubaida to school.  He also dreams of using his profits from farming to expand into new businesses to further provide for his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a devoted father, a maize farmer, the reverend of his local church and a Babban Gona member in the Chino Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to when his family members are all so happy to have enough healthy food to eat, with the support provided by Babban Gona.  

Like all Babban Gona members, Bitrus has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to reach greater heights for himself and his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a 45-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to when his family members are all so happy to have enough healthy food to eat.  Like all Babban Gona members,he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to reach greater heights for himself and his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ousmane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Décembre 2009. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ousmane (assise à l’extrême droite dans la photo), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe, c’est une femme très dynamique et joue un rôle très déterminant dans la progression du banc villageois. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants (2 Garçons et 1 fille).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend des fruits et des œufs, elle a une expérience de 06 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner au moins 5 sacs de pomme de liane communément appelé « madd » et reste pour d’autres fruits pour la revente dans les régions du centre et dans la capitale.
 
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  en vu d’acheter une maison pour ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women who are very active in their Banc Villageois, established in December 2009. They are all from the same district and get along very well. Their main enterprises are various small businesses.

Ousmane (seated on the far right in the photo), is the featured borrower of the group, and is a very dynamic woman. She plays a very important role in the progress of the Banc Villageois. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of three children (two boys and one girl). She has a stall in the market where she sells fruit and eggs, and has had six years of experience in this field.

With this loan she plans to purchase a supply of at least five sacks of pomme de liane (passion fruit) commonly called "madd." The rest of the loan she will use to purchase other fruits for resale in the central regions and in the capital. The income she earns from her business will allow her to save with the aim of buying a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of at least five sacks of pomme de liane (passion fruit) commonly called "madd," and to purchase other fruits for resale.

loans.name: Nevelyn

texts.en:
Nevelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell egg business in the Philippines.

Nevelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

Nevelyn has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 47 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Дочь-студентка, 1 сын-находится в России на заработках 2 сын -школьник,  Эльмира имеет средне-специальное образование, по характеру, спокойная, ответственная, жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая. Эльмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1987 года занимается сельским хозяйством, откормом скота, выращиванием сельхоз-продукций, выращивает клубнику. Начала этот бизнес с 800 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойных коровы, 1 бычок, 3 овцы, а также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,16 ГА, на которой выращивает эспарцет и пшеницу. Ее деятельность приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, клубники, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Дополнительным доходом считаются денежные переводы с России, где на заработках у Эльмиры находится сын. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Эльмире обучать дочь в институте. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет обновить мебель в доме.
texts.en: Elmira is 47 years old, married and has three children.  Her daughter is a student, one son works in Russia, and the other son is a school student.  Elmira has a secondary-specialized education.  She is calm, responsible, happy and hardworking.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Elmira has been involved in an agricultural business - fattening up livestock and growing agricultural crops - since 1987.  She grows strawberries.  She started this business with 800 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Elmira's business contains two dairy cows, one bull, three sheep, and also has a land plot of 1.16 hectares, where she grows sainfoin and wheat.  Her business yields about 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk, strawberries, which serves as a base for covering her family's expenses for food and needs.  Money transfers from Russia, where Elmira's son works, comprise additional income.  The income from the business allowed Elmira to educate her daughter at a university.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls for subsequent fattening up and resale.  The earnings from the loan will help Elmira to grow her business and also to update furniture at home in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulls for subsequent fattening up and resale

loans.name: Сhynara

texts.ru: Чынаре 34 года, разведена, имеет 1 дочь, проживает с родителями. Чынара имеет среднее образование, по характеру, спокойная,целеустремленная. Чынара имеет хороший опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве, в связи с этим с 2000 года занимается откормом скота. Начала этот бизнес с 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынары в хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойных коровы, 8 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Чынаре увеличить скот в хозяйстве. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Chynara is 34 years old, divorced, has one daughter and lives with her parents. Chynara has secondary education. As a person, she is quiet and hard working. Chynara has long experience with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. In this regard, she has worked with fattening cattle since year 2000. She started this business with 4,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Chynara's persistent work, she currently has three dairy cows and eight sheep on her farm. Her business brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as a basis for covering the family's food expenses and household needs. The income from the business allowed Chynara to increase the number of livestock at the farm. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Chynara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase cows. Chynara plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a 32-year-old devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Chino Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to when his family members are all so happy to have enough healthy food to eat, with the support provided by Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, Ishaku has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to reach greater heights for himself and his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bako

texts.en: Bako is a devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Chino Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to when his family members are all so happy to have enough food to eat.  Like all Babban Gona members, Bako has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue be able to use his profits to send his three children - Juliet, Titus and Mary - to school.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and offered access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Abilio

texts.es: Abilio, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado, vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Abilio is 67 years old and lives with his wife, who is his top priority.  He intends to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, as well as to hire laborers for assistance with his coffee crops.  He also will buy some seedlings so he can replant at the start of the rainy season.  His goals are to increase the density of plants in his fields, and also to take advantage of the fertile soil and climatic conditions that are favorable for the cultivation of coffee.

With these improvements, he hopes to be able to make a little profit and thus be able to improve his family's quality of life.  He will also invest a little more in his fields and be able to complete some other goals as well.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought him this loan opportunity with greater ease and at much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to grow coffee plants.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Tsirya Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to him and his family being very happy due to his increased earnings.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes that he and his family will be able to live a healthier life.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving this dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and offered access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and helping him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman, with one child who is underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

For the past seven years, Susan has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase two blower machines, hair extensions, facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo, and hair food. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase two blower machines, hair extensions, facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo, and hair food.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche sur la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 40 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité est la restauration,elle s'approvisionne en riz,en viande et d'autres ingrédients pour son activité de restauratrice.

Ainsi,elle compte acheter 05 sacs de mil pour une valeur de 5000f,
02 sacs d'arachide pour une valeur de 2000f,
un sac de riz pour une valeur de 12000f,de l'huile pour une valeur de 15000f,de la viande pour une valeur de 210000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,leur nourriture et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group has been together since 2009. It is made up of members who come from the same village, and who work mainly as merchants.

The borrower shown with her arm raised on the far left in the photo is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She runs a restaurant and purchases supplies of rice, meat, and other ingredients for her small restaurant business.

She intends to buy five bags of millet for 5,000 Francs CFA, two bags of peanuts for 2,000 Francs CFA, one bag of rice for 12,000 Francs CFA, oil for 15,000 Francs CFA, and meat for 210,000 Francs CFA. Her goals are to provide for the nutrition and education of her children, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase millet, rice, peanuts, and meat.

loans.name: John Wilmar

texts.es: John es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres y actualmente se dedica a trabajar en una empresa como encargado de los oficios varios, actividad con la que genera ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar, pues la carga económica recae sobre él. Debido a esto, John, con la intención de generar ingresos extra, desea incursionar en la venta de mercancía como ropa, accesorios, perfumería, para lo cual solicita el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (camisas, jeans, lociones, entre otros) con lo que podrá iniciar su propio negocio, alternando esta actividad con su empleo actual y así mejorar sus ingresos mensuales para solventar todas la necesidades y gastos de su hogar. John es un hombre emprendedor y juicioso, diariamente se proyecta para cumplir sus sueños, especialmente el de montar su propio negocio y ser totalmente independiente, con el cual pueda tener una estabilidad económica favorable para ofrecer a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John is a young man of 21 years of age.  He currently lives with his parents and works at a company performing a variety of duties.  This enables him to generate income to bring sustenance to his family, since they are dependent on him economically.

Given this, he intends to generate extra income.  He wishes to go into business selling merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and perfumes.  Thus, he is seeking a loan that he will use to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as shirts, jeans and lotions. This will enable him to start his own business, alternating between this and his job with his current employer.  This will lead to increased monthly income so that he can meet all of his household expenses.

John is an enterprising and judicious man.  He plans every day so that he can meet his goals, especially to launch his own business and be totally independent.  This will lead to financial stability for him so that he can provide a better quality of life for his parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as shirts, jeans and lotions.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a widowed woman with five grown up children. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business preparing dumplings. She sells from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments in the future. She dreams of expanding to a café business.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosy works hard to support her family.

Rosy has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming sugarcane. Rosy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Rosy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.  

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past eight years, she has operated a cosmetic shop selling body lotion, hair styles, hair oil, and braids, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan she is requesting of Ksh 20,000, she wants to purchase facial creams, body lotions, braids, and hair oil to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase facial creams, body lotions, braids, and hair oil to sell

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 36 years old and married, with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rica runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like sugar, soft drinks, and soap.

Rica has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like sugar, soft drinks, and soap.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a 35-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. So Tahira, as a member of a two person lending group, has requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell, so he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of profit, he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills. Tahira hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: John Ferney

texts.es: John es un hombre soltero, no tiene hijos y actualmente vive con sus padres en una zona rural del municipio de Bello. Desde que era pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, pues sus padres y abuelos siempre han realizado estas actividades y, actualmente los ingresos que genera provienen del trabajo que realiza en fincas ubicadas en el sector donde reside. John es un hombre luchador, pujante, humilde y diariamente va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante al lado de sus padres. Esto lo motiva para solicitar el segundo ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una guadaña con el fin de ampliar el portafolio de servicios que presta y así poder tener más contratos, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. De esta manera John desea ser reconocido y poder aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos, lo que le dará la oportunidad de brindar un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica a sus padres y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John is a single man and has no children. He currently lives with his parents in a rural section of the town of Bello. From a very young age, he learned about the duties on a farm since his parents and grandparents had always done this type of work. John currently earns his income by working on different farms in the area where he lives. He is a strong, determined, and humble man who looks for ways every day to get ahead alongside his parents.

For this reason, he is requesting his second loan. He will invest in the purchase of a motorized brush cutter so that he can expand the range of services that he provides and obtain more contracts. This will result in an increase in his income. By working in this manner, John wants to become recognized so that he can increase his clientele and earn more income. This will give him the opportunity to provide better well-being and financial stability for his parents so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorized brush cutter.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman, with two children who are adults. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

For the past five years, Esha has operated a charcoal-selling business. She faces a major challenge of a high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Esha wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Darikha

texts.ru: Дарике 56 лет, вдова, имеет 3 детей. Образование-среднее. С 2007 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Младший сын помогает по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Дарики, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 1 дойную корову, 2 теленка, 18 овец, 11 коз. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел размером-1,40 ГА, на которой выращивает: сено и корма для скота. Прибыль позволила Дарике размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дарика обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также планирует женить младшего сына.
texts.en: Darikha is 56 years old, a widow and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - since 2007, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Her youngest son helps her with the business.  Thanks to Darikha's hard work, today she has a good buisness, containing one dairy cow, two calves, eighteen sheep and elevel goats.  She also has a land plot of 1.40 hectares, where she grows hay and feed for the livestock.  The profits allowed Darikha to increase livestock on her farm and, thus, improve her family's welfare.  In order to further develop her business, Darikha requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock for subsequent fattening up and resale.
