She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in further increasing the livestock quantities and also plans to marry off her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy livestock for subsequent fattening up and resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Susan has been in this business for 6 years. Susan also earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Susan successfully paid up her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and farming sugarcane businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Rumana

texts.en:
This is Rumana, a very hard-working woman. She has three children who go to school. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rumana operates a motorcycle business in Likoni, Kenya and her challenge is mechanical breakdown and the buying of spare parts.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle and to repair the old one. Rumana joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle and to repair the old one.

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 38 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Старший сын-студент, остальные школьники. С 1998 года Гулжамал начала заниматься торговлей детской одежды, стартовав с суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS), Гулжамал сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, а именно на предстоящий школьный сезон Гулжамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закупку товаров детской одежды для школы. Гулжамал планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем хочет завершить строительство дома.
texts.en: Guljamal is 38 years old, married and has three children.  Her oldest son is a college student, and the rest of the children are school students.  Guljamal became involved in selling children's clothing in 1998, having started with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Guljamal was able to grow her business to have a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her merchandise selection, especially for the upcoming school season, Guljamal requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy school children's clothing.  She plans to invest the earnings from the business in further expanding merchandise selection and also wants to complete the construction of her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy school children's clothing

loans.name: Mbene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe réuni des femmes d'un même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales .
Madame Mbène la représentante de ce  groupe est  une femme veuve âgée de 39 ans  et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et deux filles toutes scolarisés. Son groupe est composé de femmes commerçantes du villages unies par de bons liens sociaux qui ont bénéficié de 21 prêts remboursés sans difficultés.
Mbène s'active dans l'embouche et avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs cfa elle  va acheter deux bœufs à 250000 francs l'un pour les revendre plus tard.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge mes besoins alimentaires scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of women from the same village share a good social bond. They are represented by Mrs. Mbène, age 39, a widowed mother of 3 boys and two girls who have received schooling. 

The group members are merchants who have previously received 21 loans, which they have repaid without difficulty.  

Mbène’s activity is cattle fattening. She will use her loan of 500,000 F cfa to buy two oxen at 250,000 apiece to sell at some point in the future. The profits from this activity allow her to feed her children and to provide for their education.

loans.use: to buy oxen to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus hijos y esposo, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y otros materiales que le faciliten realizar los trabajos de mejoras en su vivienda y pagar mano de obra, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 31, lives with her de facto and children who are her main priority. With this loan she intends to buy wood and other materials to make home improvements and pay for workers. She hopes to get rid of the leaks in her house before the rainy season, which is about to begin, so she can provide a better quality of life for her family. 

With this loan Yesenia hopes to improve the integrity of her home and with it her family's quality of life. She also intends to take advantage of the low prices of some of the materials which are also good quality. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. They haven't taken out other loans in state banks before but FUDECOSUR was able to offer her a loan with better terms at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Mboje

texts.en:
Mboje appreciates Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her to generate profits in her fish business.

She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase cooking oil, dried fish and firewood for her fish business and the rest of the money to renovate her house.

She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, dried fish and firewood for her fish business and the rest of the money to renovate her house

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Millicent appreciates the Kiva loan she received previously, which boosted her business and generated profits that enabled her take care of her family.

She is requesting for a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase tablecloths, children's wear, curtains and bedsheets for resale.

She joined Yehu to access the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths, children's wear, curtains and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima appreciates for the loan she got from Kiva that boosted her business. 

In addition, she owns rental houses that need to be repaired and renovated to attract more tenants. She is requesting for a loan to renovate her rental houses. She joined Yehu to access the funds.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Nazmeen

texts.en:
Nazmeen, aged 38, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Nazmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Nazmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for her husband's business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Tessie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her buying and selling banana business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 46 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Tita has a buy and sell crabs business in the Philippines. Tita requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell.

Tita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Tita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Ángel Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “17 de Julio”.

En este lugar vive el señor Ángel,  tiene 62 años de edad es divorciado y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores e independientes, actualmente mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual también tiene dos hijos que aun viven en su casa. Su mujer es ama de casa.

Don Ángel es un hombre muy emprendedor  que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y para que  a su familia no le falte nada, el tiene un local que arrienda en las cercanía de su casa en el cual tiene un mini Marquet, allí vende toda clase de  víveres así como también carne pescado, legumbres y muchos otros productos, en este mismo lugar tiene una panadería la cual es muy concurrida ya que sus clientes encuentran de todo en su local, allí trabaja con la ayuda de toda la familia así como también con una persona a quien le paga un sueldo mensual, él además de trabajar para su familia también es la fuente de ingresos de la familia de la persona que trabaja con ellos.

Este crédito es para  comprar más víveres para surtir su mini Marquet, harina y otros ingredientes para prepara el pan. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la solidez de la institución. 

Su sueño es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the '17 de Julio' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known as 'the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees' since colonial times. 

Angel, 62, lives in this city. He is divorced with two adult children from his previous marriage who live independently. At the moment he is living with his de facto with whom he also has two children who still live at home. His wife is a housewife. 

Angel is a very enterprising man who likes to work to get ahead so that his family don't go without anything. He runs a mini market which he rents close to his home selling all kinds of provisions including fish, pulses and many other products. He also runs a bakery from the same store which is very busy since his customers can everything there. He works there with the help of all of his family as well as a worker whom he pays a monthly salary. As well as working for his family, Angel also provides a source of income for the person who works alongside them.

This loan will go towards buying more provisions to restock his mini market as well as flour and other ingredients to make bread. He has gone through five loan cycles with this community bank and he likes it because of the stability of the institution.  

His dream is to keep his business running.

loans.use: to buy provisions, flour and other ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: Luis Guillermo, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está soltero, vive solo y su futuro es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales y pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunos problemas en la vivienda antes que inicie el periodo fuerte de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así poderle tener una mejor calidad de vida. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de mejor calidad a su casa y que mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Guillermo is a single 41-year-old man who lives on his own.  His future is his greatest priority.  With this loan he intends to purchase wood and other materials, and also to pay laborers to make repairs to his home.  This will enable him to eliminate some problems with his house before the heavy rains begin, which will be very soon, and thus improve his quality of life.

He intends to take advantage of low prices of some high-quality materials. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought him this loan opportunity with greater ease and at much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 33 años de edad; es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a sus 03 hijos, a quienes desea darles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. Carmen se dedica a la agricultura; durante las mañanas ella se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su campo de cultivo que durante 11 años viene produciendo cacao orgánico logrando mantener económicamente a su familia.
Esta siempre al tanto de los gastos que efectúan sus hijos sobre todo en la temporada escolar; por ello siempre esta al tanto de su producción de cacao y coca; sus cosechas son vendidas a distintos comerciantes quienes le ofrecen buenas ganancias por cada kilo. Con la ganancia de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de sus hijos.Es una labor que considera muy abnegada ya que es su único medio de ingreso. Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar con quienes mantiene en buen estado sus plantaciones esperando cada cierto tiempo obtener las mazorcas de cacao en buen estado. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y reemplazar algunos árboles de cacao que ya están malogrados.
texts.en:
Carmen, 33, is a single mother living in her own house with her three children who she wants to provide a good education and better quality of life for.  Carmen works in agriculture.  She rises very early in the morning to head out to her farmland that’s been producing organic cacao beans for 11 years thus being able to support her family economically.

She’s always on top of any expenses her children might generate especially during the school term which is why she’s always watchful of her cacao and coca leaf production.  She sells her crops to various merchants who offer her good per kilo profits.  With profits earned from her ha rests she’s able to cover her children’s expenses.

She considers her work to be quite self-sacrificing because it’s her only source of income.  She always gets support from local laborers with whom she keeps her crops in good condition hoping to produce good condition cacao stalks every so often.

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion she wants to have 1,000 new soles to buy seedlings to replace some of the cacao plants that have become damaged.

loans.use: to buy plant seedlings.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to increase stock in her business, which generated more profit that helped her improve her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase cooking oil, beans, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

She thanks Yehu for their loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, beans, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Jessica María

texts.es: Jessica María, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo y sus padres, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales y pagar mano de obra en la reparación a la vivienda, y de esta manera eliminar algunas entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya casi inicia y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su  hijo y familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jessica María is a single 25-year-old woman who lives with her son and her parents, who are her greatest priority.

With this loan she intends to purchase wood and other materials, and also to pay laborers to make repairs to her home. This will enable her to eliminate some leaks in her house before the heavy rains begin, which will be very soon, and thus be able to provide a better life for her son and her family.

She intends to take advantage of low prices of some high-quality materials. This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR. She has not taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought her this loan opportunity with greater ease and at much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Johel Andres

texts.es: Johel  Andrés, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está en soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra almácigo de café de una variedad adecuada para la zona además de asegurarse que tenga un buen tamaña y sanidad para que su desarrollo sea el más adecuada y hacer la siembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Johel  Andrés is a single 19-year-old man who lives with his parents and his siblings, who are his top priority. 

He intends to use this loan to purchase coffee seedlings that are appropriate for his area.  He will ensure that they are healthy and of a good size so that they will develop optimally. He will plant at the start of the rainy season. His goals are to increase the density of plants in his fields, and also to take advantage of the fertile soil and climatic conditions that are favorable for the cultivation of coffee.

With these improvements, he hopes to be able to make a little profit and thus be able to improve his family's quality of life. He will also invest a little more in his fields and be able to complete some other goals as well. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought him this loan opportunity with greater ease and at much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to grow coffee crops.

loans.name: Artykbu

texts.ru: Артыкбу, 52 года, вдова, имеет 4 детей (2сына и 2 дочери). С 1999 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 сом KGS. Дочери замужем и проживают отдельно, сыновья помогают по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, у Артыкбу имеется 0,94 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает хлопок и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития полеводства Артыкбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20 000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений. Доходы от кредита Артыкбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие полеводства и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Artykbu is 52 years old, a widow, and has four children (two sons and two daughters). She has worked with field crop cultivation since 1999, after having started this business with an amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Her daughters are married and live by themselves, the sons help with the farm. Artykbu has been able to develop the business, and currently she has 0.94 hectares of irrigated land on which she each year grows cotton and corn. 

With an aim to further develop her farming, Artykbu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fertilizers. Artykbu plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing the business and in improving the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса живет и работает в городе Мелитополь. Она торгует мужской одеждой в ассортименте на одном из привокзальных рынков. Раиса уже выкупила киоск и теперь может экономить на затратах на аренду. 
Раисе нужна сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы оптом закупить товар на осень-зиму под реализацию. За счет дополнительной партии товара Раиса надеется постепенно развивать свой бизнес дальше и улучшать благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Raisa lives and works in the city of Melitopol. She sells an assortment of men's clothing at one of the railway station markets. Raisa already bought a stall and can currently save the rent. 

Raisa needs an amount of 10,000 hryvnia in order to purchase goods wholesale to sell during the fall and winter season. Based on the additional goods, Raisa would like to stepwise develop her business further and improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase goods wholesale for the fall and winter season

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Virgie works hard to support her family.

Virgie has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Virgie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional products such as noodles, sugar, chips and canned goods to sell in her general store.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, sugar, chips and canned goods

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos  hijos, vive con sus familiares, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.
 
Se dedica a la venta de discos  y es policía municipal. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar una lavadora, refrigeradora, . Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar sus electrodomesticos al contado y con descuento.  Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas cada semana.
   
Su sueño es tener sucursales de mi negocio en todo el país. 

Su desafío  es la capacidad especial. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  descansar en la casa
texts.en:
Juan, 37, is single and has two children; he lives with relatives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He works selling records and is also a municipal police officer.  

He requests the loan to buy a washing machine and a refrigerator.  With support from the loan he will be able to buy his home appliances for cash and with a discount.  He makes his purchases weekly in Ventanas.  

His dream is to have branches of his business throughout the country.  His challenge is special ability.  He enjoys resting at home in his free time.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Bubush

texts.ru: Бубуш 62 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Бубуш имеет среднее образование. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1991 году Бубуш начала свой бизнес в откорме скота. Стартовав с 500 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Бубуш имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 48 овец. Также имеет земельный надел размером 6,0 ГА, где в основном выращивает эспарцет и ячмень. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Старшая дочь замужем, проживает отдельно, сын женат, помогает родителям материально. Доходы от бизнеса Бубуш вложила в оплату за образование своих детей. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубуш обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на закупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бубуш планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и намерена сделать косметический ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Bubush is 62 years old, married, and has two children. Bubush has secondary education. In search of a source of income for her family, Bubush started her business of fattening cattle in 1991. After being started with 500 som (KGS), her business currently has a monthly income in the amount of 7,000 som (KGS). 

Bubush has two dairy cows and 48 sheep on her farm. She also has a plot of land of size 6.0 hectares, where she mainly grows perennial herbs and barley. Her husband helps her with the business. The eldest daughter is married, and lives separately. Her son is married and helps his parents financially. Bubush invested the income from the business in paying for her children's education. 

To further the development of her business, Bubush turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of steers to fatten and resell. Bubush plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock and intends to do cosmetic repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Kholnazar

texts.ru:
Холназар житель района Шахритус. Ему 33 года. Он хороший семьянин. У него заботливая жена и двое детей. Холназар занимается животноводством. Одновременно он хочет заняться торговым бизнесом. Холназар на центральном рынке района арендовал магазин и намерен заняться там продажей запасных частей автомашин. Он имеет сбережение в размере 3500 TJS, накопленные за счет животноводства. 
Холназар обратился за кредитом, целью которого является закуп запасных частей автомашин, чтобы открыть магазин.  Он заинтересован в открытии данного бизнеса, так как считает, что это довольно прибыльный бизнес. Холназар будет оптом привозить товар с города Душанбе и продавать в своем магазине по розничной цене. Он надеется, что кредиторы KIVA поддержат его в начинании бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kholnazar is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 33 years old. He is a good family man. He has a caring wife and two children.

Kholnazar works with livestock breeding. At the same time he would like to work with sales. Kholnazar rented a store at the central market in the region and intends to sell spare parts for vehicles there. He has savings in the amount of 3,500 TJS, accumulated through the livestock breeding. 

Kholnazar applied for a loan with an aim to purchase spare parts for vehicles, in order to open the store. He is interested in opening this business because he things this is quite a profitable business. Kholnazar will bring wholesale goods from the city of Dushanbe and sell them at his market at a retail price. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him in starting the business.

loans.use: to purchase and resell spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Юлия – из Мелитополя. Она – рыночный предприниматель. Торгует на местном рынке женской одеждой. Киоск, в котором Юлия работает, она арендует. 
Юлии необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар на осень и подготовиться к наступающему холодному сезону.  Полученную прибыль Юлия хочет вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, так как видит хороший потенциал для его расширения.
texts.en:
Yuliya is from Melitopol. She is an entrepreneur at the market. She sells women's clothing at the local market. She rents the stall which she works at.

Yuliya needs an amount of 15,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seasonal goods for the fall and prepare for the upcoming cold season. Yuliya plans to invest the income received in further developing her business, as she sees large potential in expanding.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for the fall

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a devoted father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Tsirya Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his 1.7-hectare farm and looks forward to him and his family being very happy.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes that he and his family will be able to live a healthier life.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and with access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier and helping him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 45-year-old devoted father, maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Tsirya Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to him and his family being very happy.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes that he and his family will be able to live a healthier life.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and offered access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, so his family can eat healthier maize and he can get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Francis

texts.es: Francis es una joven muy luchadora. Ella ha logrado salir adelante sola y darle de alimento a sus hijos y a su madre. ella ya termino la secundaria y actualmente esta intentando ingresar a la carrera de secretariado ejecutivo por lo que necesita de un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (500.000) para poder comprar los materiales necesarios para estudiar.  con esto  va a poder empezar su carrera y tener un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en: Francis is a hardworking young woman.  She’s managed to get ahead alone and to provide food for her children and for her mother.  She’s completed secondary school and is currently trying to start an Executive Secretary career which is why she needs a five-hundred thousand colon loan (500,000) to be able to buy the materials she needs for her studies.  With this she’ll be able to start her career and have a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a fruit and vegetable vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, pineapples and other fruits to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to cater to more customers and buyers in her store. 

In the future, Imelda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, pineapples and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sinforoza

texts.en:
Sinforoza, 54, is married with three children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

Sinforoza owns and operates farmland. To earn a living, she helps her husband to plant and harvest rice for sale in her local community. She has been farming for years.

Since 2008, Sinforoza has been a member of the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. She is requesting a new  loan of 15,000 PHP to finance the land preparation labor costs and buy seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to finance the land preparation labor costs and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa. Liezel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a 37-year-old husband, father of three, and farmer from Tsirya village in Kaduna.  He is also a member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, Nuhu has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  Nuhu is excited to see the change in his farm since he became a Babban Gona member and is able to visualize his potential profit.  With this increase in earnings, Nuhu is on his way to achieving his dreams of providing his children with the best possible education while increasing their standard of living.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with 2.5 bags of high quality fertilizer and 3 2 kg bags of Aflasafe, which protects maize from toxins, for his 0.6-hectare farm.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Lado

texts.en: Lado is a 50-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Tsirya Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to transitioning from life as a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to bring positive change to his life and his family and achieve the best livelihood he can ever think of.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and also offered access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Tsirya Village of Kaduna. Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to bring positive change to his life and his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Philimon

texts.en: Philimon is a 28-year-old farmer who has big dreams of changing his family’s life through the profits earned from his farm in Tsirya village.  A father of three, he is excited about the opportunity to turn his small farm into a small scale business.  Like all Babban Gona members, Philimon has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Philimon looks forward to giving his children the very best things in life while investing in his farm to ensure it is a profitable business.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with 2.5 bags of high quality fertilizer and 3.25 2kg bags of Aflasafe, which protects maize from toxins, for his 0.6-hectare farm.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Nuhu

loans.name: Maikudi

texts.en: Maikudi is a 25-year-old hardworking maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunity to increase his income and have enough food for his family.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to making a profit on his 1.7-hectare maize farm.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snacks, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, cold drinks and more to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a 40 year old maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunity to increase his income and have enough food for his family.  Like all Babban Gona members, Sani has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He is looking forward to making profits on his 1.7-hectare plot of land.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams of developing himself and achieving higher yields.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samalia is a 45-year-old husband and father of four.  He is a hard working farmer and as a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Samalia has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, Samalia looks forward to educating his children whom he considers his pride and joy.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a vibrant 25-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to increase his income.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes his family will be happy all year round, and this loan is helping him achieve this dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en: Uwani is a 35-year-old female maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to increase her income from the maize produced on her 1.7-hectare farm.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, she hopes her family will be happy all year round, and this loan offers her the opportunity to achieve this dream.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and for her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is 56 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rossana is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed to sell.

Rossana has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed to sell

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine's business is doing great. She paid back her first loan from Kiva without many challenges. She lives in the Mariakani area and sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for more than two years and the business is doing wonderfully. 

She discovered Milango through friends and she found this to be an opportunity to grow her business. She now seeks a loan to purchase clothes to sell in her shop. The income that she will raise will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes
